member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.AnnotateSpaceConverter
member.summary: The AnnotateSpaceConverter class provides helper methods for converting from one coordinate space to another.
The AnnotateSpaceConverter class provides helper methods for converting from one coordinate space to another.
member.remarks: If any changes occur to the annotation or viewer matrices after the AnnotateSpaceConverter is created, the calculations will not be correct. If changes will be made to the annotation during this time it's best to use the static methods instead.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of AnnotateSpaceConverter specifying the parent and objects that will be used for the conversion methods.
member.param: The parent used for converting between view, document and annotation spaces. This can be null (Nothing in VB) if only converting between document and annotation space.
The object used for converting. This can be null (Nothing in VB) if only converting between view and document space.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.AnnotationData

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Annotate.AnnotationData._transform
member.summary: Gets or sets the transformation matrix used for rendering this annotation.
member.value: A transformation matrix used for rendering.

remarks.para: Each annotation has multiple matrices. The Transform property matrix is multiplied in after all others, allowing for a custom transform.
Note: The RotateDocument method applies a transform to this matrix.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Annotate.AnnotationData.GetRenderTransform
member.summary: Returns a System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Matrix containing the matrices applied to the annotation.
member.returns: A Matrix containing all of the matrices applied to the annotation.

remarks.para: Internally several matrices are used to hold the position, rotation and mirroring of the annotation. This method will return a single Matrix combining these matrices along with the public property.
This Matrix should be disposed when finished working with it.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.AnnotationImage
member.summary: This class represents an image object used by and classes.

remarks.para: The properties of this class describe the image data, allowing the image data to be read by any application into a format it requires.

The property is used to store the actual image created from these property values. Our default implementation will create a System.Drawing.Imaging.Image object. Inheritors should override the method to generate the image object.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.IWangCompatible
member.summary: This interface is used to indicate that an AnnotationData object is WANG compatible.

remarks.para: The WangFormatter will only convert AnnotationData objects that implement the IWangCompatible interface. Below is a list of classes which implement this interface:

Note to implementors:
In addition to the GetWangAttributeData method there must be a constructor that takes a WangAttributeData object in the class to allow the WangFormatter to deserialize the data.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Annotate.IWangCompatible.GetWangAttributeData
member.summary: Returns a object containing information about the annotation to be formatted as WANG data.
member.returns: A object containing the information required to generate WANG data.

remarks.para: The WangFormatter will call this method when serializing the AnnotationData.

Note to implementors:,
In addition to the GetWangAttributeData method there must be a constructor that takes a WangAttributeData object in the class to allow the WangFormatter to deserialize the data.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.AnnotationController._parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent control where the annotations will be rendered.
member.value: The control where the annotations will be rendered.
member.remarks: Each AnnotationController must have its own IAnnotate parent. Giving multiple AnnotationController objects the same parent will cause unforeseen consequences and is not supported. This property should be set to null (Nothing in Visual Basic) when the controller is being replaced by another AnnotationController.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.AnnotationController._activeAnnotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the currently selected annotation.
member.value: The active annotation being used.

remarks.para: An annotation becomes active when the user selects it using the mouse. When multiple annotations are selected the ActiveAnnotation will be the last annotation selected by the user.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.AnnotationController._currentLayer
member.summary: Gets or sets the current active layer.
member.value: The current being used.

remarks.para: When an annotation is selected, either through code or by the user, the layer it's contained in becomes the current layer. When multiple annotations in different layers are selected, the last selected annotation's layer will become the current layer.
When an annotation is created by the user, it will be added as a child of the current layer.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.AnnotationUndoManager
member.summary: The AnnotationUndoManager keeps track of annotation changes and allows undo and redo functionality.
member.remarks: In addition to annotation property changes, the undo manager will track adding and removing annotations from a layer. This includes adding and removing LayerAnnotation objects in the LayerCollection.

member.name: E:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.AnnotationUndoManager.UndoRequest
member.summary: Raised when a call to has been requested.
member.remarks: The AnnotationUndoManager itself does not perform the undo action.

member.remarks: The AnnotationUndoManager itself does not perform the redo action.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.AnnotationUndoManager.BeginUndoMerge
member.summary: This method puts the into a collective undo state. All calls to will be collected until the method has been called.
member.remarks: Use this method along with to place multiple undo operations into a single undo request.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.AnnotationUndoManager.EndUndoMerge(System.String)
member.summary: Exits the collective undo state and stores all actions added since the call as a single undo operation.
member.param: A short description of the collective undo action.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the manager is merging undos added into a single undo action.
member.value: A value indicating if the manager is merging undos.
member.remarks: This property will be true between calls to the BeginUndoMerge and EndUndoMerge methods which allow multiple undos to be merged into a single undo action.

summary.para: This annotation is designed to provide additional information on a specific area of the document. It contains an editable text area and a leader line used to point to the area of the document.

When creating this annotation, the first click sets the target for the leader and a second click sets the annotation location. It can also be created by pressing down the mouse button to set the leader and dragging. Both annotation and leader point can be repositioned independently after the annotation has been created.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.Importers.AnnotationImporter

summary.para: AnnotationImporter is an abstract base class used to define how annotations are imported from arbitrary data files into DotImage.

para.FONT: This class is obsolete: Use AnnotationDataImporter instead.

member.remarks: Since this class is abstract, you can't use it directly.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.Importers.AnnotationImporter.Load
member.summary: The load method is used to allow an AnnotationImporter to load and to possibly cache annotations.
member.remarks: Load is called automatically by any method that needs to access internal annotation data (e.g., PageCount or Import). Load is present for clients who want to control when annotation data is specifically loaded.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.Importers.AnnotationImporter.Import
member.summary: Imports all annotations as LayerCollection.
member.returns: A new LayerCollection object representing annotations for the entire document. Each LayerAnnotation within the collection represents one page of annotations. If a page has no annotations, the LayerAnnotation will be non-null, but empty.
member.overloads: Imports annotations from a source
member.remarks: must be called before any of the Import methods.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.Importers.AnnotationImporter.Import(System.Int32)
member.summary: Imports a page of annotations as LayerAnnotation.
member.returns: A LayerAnnotation containing a set of annotations from the page.
member.param: The zero-based page from which annotations will be imported. page is range checked against the document.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.Importers.AnnotationImporter.Import(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Imports a single annotation from a given page of annotations.
member.returns: A single AnnotationUI object representing the imported annotation.
member.param: The zero-based page from which annotations will be imported. page is range checked against the document.
The zero-based annotation which will be imported. annotIndex is range checked against the number of annotations of the page. The number of annotations on a page is available through .

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.Importers.AnnotationImporter.PageCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of pages in a document.
member.remarks: It is not necessary to call Load before accessing PageCount; this will happen automatically.

member.summary: Returns the number of annotations on a conceptual page of a document.
member.param: page is an integer that represents the conceptual zero based page index of a document. It will be range checked against the total number of pages in the document.

member.summary: This class is used to hold a collection of objects.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.PointBaseAnnotation
member.summary: This abstract class is used to simplify creating annotations that are defined with multiple points instead of a rectangular structure.
member.remarks: The PointBaseAnnotation class takes care of most user interaction code required for points based annotations such as the Freehand, Lines and Polygon annotations. Annotations derived from PointBaseAnnotation essentially only need to add custom constructors to function properly.
member.summary: This abstract class is used to simplify creating annotations that are defined with multiple points instead of a rectangular structure.
member.remarks: The PointBaseAnnotation class takes care of most user interaction code required for points based annotations such as the Freehand, Lines and Polygon annotations. Annotations derived from PointBaseAnnotation essentially only need to add custom constructors and override the GetRegion method to function properly.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.UI.PolygonAnnotation
member.summary: A PolygonAnnotation is a series of points used to draw a polygon with an optional fill.

remarks.para: To generate a polygon, the user clicks the left mouse button to set each point. The user can stop adding points by clicking the right mouse button.
A polygon requires at least three points in the Points collection.

members.member: A custom Stream object that is used to read and write images to a file. This is the default stream object used when specifying filenames for images. Deprecated, use StreamHandler64 in preferance to this class. This File Stream object is approximately 20% faster than the System.IO.FileStream object for loading images. ATTENTION: Is the above remark still true given newer versions of the CLR? mkalininskij

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaFile64Stream.#ctor(System.String,System.IO.FileMode,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of AtalaFileStream.
member.param: The file name that this stream will write to or read from.
Specifies how the operating system should open the file to read or write.
Specified if the file is read, write, or read/write.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaFile64Stream.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the stream in bytes.
member.value: The length of the stream in bytes.
member.remarks: The property must return true before you can get the length of the stream.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaFile64Stream.Position
member.summary: Gets the current position of the stream pointer.
member.value: The current position of the stream pointer.
member.remarks: The property must return true before you can access the Position of the stream.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaFile64Stream.Close
member.summary: Closes the stream.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaFile64Stream.Seek
member.summary: Moves the file pointer to the beginning of the stream.
member.returns: The new position within the file.
member.overloads: Moves the file pointer for an open stream.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaFile64Stream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Moves the file pointer to a specific position within the stream.
member.returns: The new position within the file
member.param: The number of bytes to move the pointer, up to a maximum value of 2^31 - 1.
Specifies whether the offset is from the beginning, end or current position.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage
member.summary: The AtalaImage object holds the raw image data, a Palette, and methods used to access this data.

remarks.para: Image data is stored in a 32-bit row aligned buffer. See and for methods that will export or import from a DIB (Device Independent Bitmap).
The AtalaImage is used throughout DotImage and is similar to the Bitmap object in .NET.

code.title: Create an AtalaImage from a file (C#)

example.code: AtalaImage image = new AtalaImage("image.png");

code.title: Create an AtalaImage from a file (Visual Basic)

example.code: Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("image.png")

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.DitherErrorMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the diffusion or dither error that's applied to an image when converting to from a continuous tone to colormapped format.
member.value: The diffusion or dither error that's applied to an image when converting to from a continuous tone to colormapped format.

remarks.para: This value can be from 0 to 127 where 0 is with no error diffusion and 127 is maximum error diffusion.
See the Dithering topic for more information.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.PixelFormatChanger
member.summary: Get or set the class used to convert image pixel formats.
member.value: An object of type PixelFormatChanger that can be used to convert images from one PixelFormat to another.

remarks.para: This class is used by AtalaImage. as well as by all DotImage image commands. By changing this property, a client can control how all pixel format conversions are manager.
By default this property is set to an instance of .

member.name: E:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.ChangePixelFormat
member.summary: Occurs when the image data changes PixelFormats.
member.remarks: This static event is usually fired when a particular method is not compatible with the current and it needs to be changed. By handling this event, you may show a dialog to the user that the current PixelFormat will be changed and allow that operation to be cancelled by setting the Cancel property in the to true.

example.code:
Private Sub OnPixelFormatChange(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As PixelFormatChangeEventArgs) Handles AtalaImage.ChangePixelFormat ' Don't allow a 24-bit image to be converted to 8-bit grayscale. If e.CurrentPixelFormat = PixelFormat.Pixel24bppBgr And e.NewPixelFormat = PixelFormat.Pixel8bppGrayscale Then e.Cancel = True End If End Sub
' Force the handler to cancel the operation. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg") Dim gray As AtalaImage = image.GetChangedPixelFormat(PixelFormat.Pixel8bppGrayscale, Nothing, True)
image.Dispose() If Not gray Is Nothing Then gray.Dispose() End If

member.param: The to use when determining if there is an alpha channel.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.Dispose
member.summary: Call this method to destroy this AtalaImage data and free memory.

remarks.para: The garbage collector will eventually free this memory if dispose is not called. By calling Dispose the memory is freed immediately, important for images occupying many kilobytes of memory.
After the image is disposed, any function calls that access the AtalaImage.ImageData will result in an ObjectIsDisposedException.

member.returns: A new object with a different %PixelFormat% from this AtalaImage.

example.code:
' Load an image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg") Dim converted As AtalaImage = Nothing
' Convert the image to 8-bit Grayscale. ' Be sure the image is a different PixelFormat or an exception is thrown. If image.PixelFormat <> PixelFormat.Pixel8bppGrayscale Then converted = image.GetChangedPixelFormat(PixelFormat.Pixel8bppGrayscale) image.Dispose() Else converted = image End If

member.overloads: This function converts an AtalaImage from one PixelFormat to another.
member.remarks: The ChangePixelFormatCommand can also be used to change the pixelformat, using a Command.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.FromBitmapData(System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData,System.Drawing.Imaging.ColorPalette)
member.summary: Returns an %AtalaImage% that contains the same image pointer that's in the specified BitmapData object.
member.returns: An %AtalaImage% that contains the same image pointer that's in the specified BitmapData object.
member.remarks: Use this method to set an existing Bitmap object to an AtalaImage without copying the data. This method should be used with care as the source Bitmap will always control the image memory, and can be disposed by the garbage collector if all references are removed.

example.code: Dim bd As BitmapData = srcBitmap.LockBits(New Rectangle(Point.Empty, srcBitmap.Size), _ ImageLockMode.ReadWrite, srcBitmap.PixelFormat) 'pass in the Bitmap Bits, with a null palette Dim image As AtalaImage = AtalaImage.FromBitmapData(bd, Nothing) Dim blur As BlurGaussianCommand = New BlurGaussianCommand(2) Dim newImage As AtalaImage = blur.ApplyToImage(image) srcBitmap.UnlockBits(bd) 'the Bitmap only points to the newImage. The newImage still controls the memory and it will need'to be disposed when done. Dim newBitmap As Bitmap = New Bitmap(newImage.Width, newImage.Height, newImage.RowStride, _ CType(CType(newImage.PixelFormat, Integer), System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat), newImage.ImageData);

member.param: The BitmapData created from a Bitmap by locking the bits.
The palette of the Bitmap. Set to null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the Bitmap doesn't contain a palette.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.FromBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a specified Bitmap into an AtalaImage by taking ownership of the Bitmap data, or returning a copy of the Bitmap data.

remarks.para: When setting atalaImageWillOwnBitmap to true, do not Dispose the Bitmap. The AtalaImage object holds onto a reference to the Bitmap object, so the garbage collector will not free the Bitmap data until the host AtalaImage goes out of scope or is disposed.
When atalaImageWillOwnBitmap is false, a copy is returned and it's up to the caller to dispose the Bitmap.

member.param: The source Bitmap to convert
When true, the Bitmap data will be owned by the AtalaImage.
member.returns: A copy of a GDI+ System.Drawing.Bitmap object in the form of an object.
member.overloads: Converts a specified Bitmap into an AtalaImage.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.FromBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Returns an AtalaImage containing a copy of the Bitmap.
member.remarks: It's up to the caller to dispose the Bitmap. The AtalaImage object does not own the bitmap data.
member.returns: A copy of the Bitmap data in the form of an AtalaImage object.
member.param: The bitmap to create a copy from.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.GetBitmap
member.returns: A object from this data.
member.summary: Returns a System.Drawing.Bitmap object copied from this %AtalaImage%.
member.returns: A System.Drawing.Bitmap object copied from this %AtalaImage%.
member.remarks: This method will always copy the image data into a new Bitmap object.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat)

summary.para: Initialize a new instance of the %AtalaImage% class specifying the image pointer, Width, Height, and PixelFormat.
This method is obsolete. Please use the constructor that takes a PixelMemory object instead.

remarks.para: This constructor can be used to create an AtalaImage object from existing image data. The memory pointer will be managed by the AtalaImage object, so do not free the memory once the pointer is assigned to this object.
The RowStride of the image data must be 32-bit (DWORD) aligned.

member.param: The memory pointer of the image bits of an unpacked DIB (Device Independent Bitmap).
Width of the image.
Height of the image.
PixelFormat of the image.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.ImageData
member.remarks: Similarly to the GDI+ Bitmap object, the memory bits AtalaImage can be directly manipulated with this pointer. There is no need to Lock the pointer.
member.summary: Gets the memory address of this AtalaImage. This property is unsupported. Using it will cause a compilation error. Use PixelMemory instead.

example.para: This example shows how to use unsafe C# code to manipulate the image data directly. The /unsafe compiler directive must be used.

value.para: This property is unsupported. Using it will cause a compilation error. Use PixelMemory instead.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.BitmapMirror
member.remarks: The image data is tied to the object from which the Bitmap was created. As long as the AtalaImage is still in scope, the Bitmap may be used. The intension of this property is to call and methods that require a Bitmap object such as .
member.value: A object mirroring this .
member.summary: Gets the Bitmap mirror of this %AtalaImage%.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.CountColors
member.summary: Count the number of unique colors in this .
member.returns: The number of unique colors in this .
member.remarks: For colormapped images, this method could return a different number of colors then what's stored in the property. That is because this method actually loops through each pixel in the image to count the unique number of colors. However these colors might occupy more then the first x colors in the palette.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage.Draw(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws a specified area of this AtalaImage onto a System.Drawing.Graphics object at the specified location and size.
member.remarks: This method will draw the image onto a graphics object and convert to a bottom-top Bitmap if necessary. Some devices such as printers will fail when drawing a top-bottom image such as those internally stored in DotImage and .NET.
member.param: The Graphics object to draw on.
The rectangular area of the Graphics object to draw on.
The rectangular area of the source image to draw.
When true, the image will be forced to draw bottom to top.

remarks.para: By default, when opening a TIFF image using the or objects, this decoder will automatically be selected from the collection and does not have to be explicitly set.
TIFF images can contain multiple pages in one file. You may wish to specify which page to read or get information about by specifying the frameindex in the associated Read methods.
TIFF images can store metadata such as EXIF, IPTC, XMP, and other TIFF tags. See the %Atalasoft.Imaging.Metadata% namespace for more information on reading this information.

summary.para: An ImageDecoder used to read Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) images from an image Stream.

example.para: Split a multi-page TIFF into individual pages
example.code: 'initialize an instance of a TiffDecoder Dim tiffReader As TiffDecoder = New TiffDecoder() 'open the file stream Dim fs As FileStream = File.OpenRead("C:\Development\Image Database\Tiff\1_multi.tif") 'get the number of pages in the TIFF Dim pageCount As Integer = tiffReader.GetFrameCount(fs) 'loop through each page in the TIFF Dim i As Integer For i = 0 To pageCount - 1 'seek to the beginning of the file fs.Seek(0, SeekOrigin.Begin) 'read the specified frameindex Dim page As AtalaImage = tiffReader.Read(fs, i, Nothing) 'save the page as a standalone TIFF in the working directory page.Save(Path.GetFileNameWithoutExtension(fs.Name) & "_" & i & ".tif", New TiffEncoder(), Nothing) 'dispose of uneeded image page.Dispose() Next

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that when true (the default) will automatically correct the image orientation by rotating and/or flipping based on the TIFF_ORIENTATION tag setting.
member.remarks: Speed can be improved when setting this value to false on large images where the orientation is a value other than 1, however the resulting image will be rotated and/or flipped. The methods , , and ignore this setting and will never correct for orientation.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffDecoder.ReadRegion(System.IO.Stream,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Int32,Atalasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventHandler)
member.summary: Decodes a specified region of a TIFF image given a source Stream.

remarks.para: This method will read only the strips or tiles that it needs in order to compose and image of the indicated rectangular region, and trim any excess data. This can be significantly faster than reading the entire image if only a specified region needs to be decoded. To maximize benefit of this method, use multiple tiles or strips per image.
For reading only a single strip or tile, see or .
Note that the image data is not corrected for orientation even when is true.

member.exception: Thrown if the image stream is not located at the beginning of a valid TIFF file.
Thrown if the region parameter is outside the image bounds.
member.param: A Stream containing the encoded image data.
A rectangular region of the image to decode.
The zero based frame index to load from a multi-page Tiff file.
The progress delegate. Can be set to null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffDecoder.ReadTile(System.IO.Stream,System.Drawing.Point,System.Int32,Atalasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventHandler)
member.summary: Decodes a specified tile from a TIFF image stream that is encoded with strips.
member.exception: Thrown when the top-left corner of a tile doesn't exist at the location specified.

remarks.para: This method differs from in that it doesn't check that the source image is tiled. For reading multiple tiles at once, ReadRegion is more efficient. To determine the tile size, query the tag TIFFTAG_TILELENGTH (323) or TIFFTAG_TILEWIDTH (322). If those tags do not exist, then the image is stripped in which case see .
Note that the image data is not corrected for orientation even when is true.

member.exception: Thrown if the image stream is not located at the beginning of a valid TIFF file.
member.param: A Stream containing the encoded image data.
The pixel location of the top left location of the tile.
The zero based frame index to load from a multi-page Tiff file.
The progress delegate. Can be set to null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffDecoder.ReadStrip(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Int32,Atalasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventHandler)
member.summary: Decodes a specified strip from a TIFF image stream that is encoded with strips.

remarks.para: This method differs from in that it doesn't check that the source image is stripped. For reading multiple strips at once, ReadRegion is more efficient. To determine the strip height, query the tag TIFFTAG_ROWSPERSTRIP (278). To determine if an image is stripped, make sure TIFFTAG_TILELENGTH (323) or TIFFTAG_TILEWIDTH (322) doesn't exist.
Note that the image data is not corrected for orientation even when is true.

member.exception: Thrown when the strip index doesn't exist within the image.
Thrown if the image stream is not located at the beginning of a valid TIFF file.
member.param: A Stream containing the encoded image data.
The zero based strip index to decode.
The zero based frame index to load from a multi-page Tiff file.
The progress delegate. Can be set to null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffDecoder.GetTiffTag(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a TIFF Tag from a TIFF file.
member.returns: Returns a object containing the tag data, or null if the tag does not exist in the image.
member.param: The tag ID to retrieve data from.
The TIFF filename
The zero based frame index of the page to query.

remarks.para: Information stored in a TIFF file can be obtained with this method. A TiffTag is class containing the object data, data type, and tag id. The data is typically a string value.
Not all TIFF Tags are currently supported. See TIFF Tags for a list of supported tags.
This method can be used to obtain WANG Annotations data saved as TagID 32932.
For more comprehensive TIFF Tag handling, see the "/> for a list of supported tags.
This method can be used to obtain WANG Annotations data saved as TagID 32932.
For more comprehensive TIFF Tag handling, see the class in the Atalasoft.dotImage assembly.

member.overloads: Gets a TIFF Tag from a file or stream.

example.para: This example demonstrates how to obtain a simple TIFF Tag from a TIFF image.
example.code: Dim tag As TiffTag = TiffDecoder.GetTiffTag(TiffTagID.Software, "myimage.tif", 0) If Not tag Is Nothing Then MessageBox.Show(tag.ToString(), Me) End If

member.returns: Returns a object containing the tag data, or null if the tag does not exist in the image.

summary.para: An that will write Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) images to a .

remarks.para: This ImageEncoder can be passed into the the or objects when saving to specify a TIFF image.
Metadata can be written with the TIFF image including EXIF, IPTC, XMP, and Photoshop Resources. See the %Atalasoft.Imaging.Metadata% namespace for more information.
If the image being saved contains a , it will be embedded within the file.

If the image being saved is 1-bit, and palette index 0 is black and palette index 1 is white, the image will be saved with the photometric value of MINISBLACK. If other viewers mistakingly view the image reversed, invert the image and palette data prior to saving.
When compressing TIFF images, it's sometimes useful to adjust the StripSize to something other than the default. In particular, Deflate and LZW compression work better with larger chunks of data.

example.code:
' Load the image you want to append. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\TIFF\1-bit.tif")
' Create the TiffEncoder and tell it to append to an existing file. Dim tiff As TiffEncoder = New TiffEncoder(TiffCompression.Group4FaxEncoding, True)
' Append the image. image.Save("D:\Test Images\TIFF\append.tif", tiff, Nothing)
image.Dispose()

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffEncoder.TiffTags
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of TIFF Tags that will be encoded with the image when writing.
member.value: A collection of TIFF Tags that will be encoded with the image when writing.

remarks.para: Not all TIFF Tags are supported. See TIFF Tags for a list of supported tags. Some standard tags included in this list would be dangerous to modify and will be ignored if an attempt is made to add them. Those exceptions include:

IMAGEWIDTH,
IMAGELENGTH,
BITSPERSAMPLE,
COMPRESSION,
PHOTOMETRIC,
STRIPOFFSETS,
SAMPLESPERPIXEL,
ROWSPERSTRIP,
STRIPBYTECOUNTS,
PLANARCONFIG,
JPEGTABLES,
JPEGPROC,
JPEGIFOFFSET,
JPEGIFBYTECOUNT,
JPEGRESTARTINTERVAL,
JPEGLOSSLESSPREDICTORS,
JPEGPOINTTRANSFORM,
JPEGQTABLES,
JPEGDCTABLES,
JPEGACTABLES,
YCBCRCOEFFICIENTS,
YCBCRSUBSAMPLING,
YCBCRPOSITIONING
For more comprehensive TIFF Tag handling, see the class in the Atalasoft.dotImage assembly.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffEncoder.IsDangerousToSet(Atalasoft.Imaging.Metadata.TiffTag)
member.summary: Predicate, true if a tag is dangerous to add directly to the TiffTags collection of a TiffEncoder
member.param: the tag to examine
member.returns: true if it is dangerous to add this tag, false otherwise
member.remarks: Generally we consider a tag dangerous if (a) it is automatically and correctly generated by our code when needed, or (b) setting it to an incorrect value could crash a TIFF reader.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffEncoder._stripSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the strip size used when saving the image.
member.value: The strip size used when saving the image.

remarks.para: The strip size is the number of image rows saved as a single strip in the TIFF. The default value is -1, which will automatically calculate a strip size equal to about 8Kb of uncompressed data. For higher compression, it often makes sense to increase this number.
If the StripSize is greater than the image height, the actual strip size will equal the image height.

member.exception: The strip size must be a value greater than or equal to -1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffEncoder.StripSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the strip size used when saving the image.
member.value: The strip size used when saving the image.

remarks.para: The strip size is the number of image rows saved as a single strip in the TIFF. The default value is -1, which will automatically calculate a strip size equal to about 8Kb of uncompressed data. For higher compression, it often makes sense to increase this number.
If the StripSize is greater than the image height, the actual strip size will equal the image height.

member.exception: The strip size must be a value greater than or equal to -1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffEncoder.TileSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of tiles that are saved when is true.

remarks.para: The size of tiles that are saved when is true. The default value is 256, 256.
The tile size must be a multiple of 16. Actual sizes used may be subject to modification based on compression type.

member.value: The size of tiles that are saved when is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffEncoder.WriteTiled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that when true, will cause TIFF images to be encoded tiled.
member.remarks: Tiled TIFF images are useful when the image is large, and the reader is capable of reading individual tiles. See for setting the tile width and length.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffEncoder.UseLzwPredictor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating LZW predictor.
member.remarks: When this value it true and image uses LZW compression, images are generally compressed more.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.TiffEncoder.WriteImageColorProfile
member.summary: Controls how the TiffEncoder writes color profiles.

value.para: When set to true, if an image contains a non-null ColorProfile objects, the ColorProfile will be embedded within the Tiff file.
Default value is false.

member.remarks: ColorProfile objects are not written when the DotImage license is Photo.

member.summary: Windows Bitmap. Read and Write.

member.summary: Adobe (tm) Photoshop format. Read and Write (flattened image only).

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.EpsEncoder

summary.para: An that will write Adobe Encapsulated PostScript images to a .

member.remarks: This can be passed into the the or Workspace objects when saving to specify an EPS image. The output format conforms to the Adobe Encapsulated PostScript 3.0 specification.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.EpsEncoder._includeShowPage
member.summary: Determines whether or not this image will include the PostScript showpage command.

remarks.para: Some applications that consume EPS do not handle the showpage command gracefully. Suppressing it may help incompatible application handle the image correctly.
Setting this property to false will prevent the image from displaying if it is sent directly to a PostScript device.
The default value is true.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.EpsEncoder._resolution
member.summary: Sets the output resolution of the image.

remarks.para: This property is ignored if is set to true.
The default value is 72 pixels per inch.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.EpsEncoder._useImageResolution
member.summary: Determine whether or not to use the resolution of the image to be saved.

remarks.para: If this property is set to true, then the resolution off the image will be used for conversion to EPS. If the image resolution has no units or the resolution is invalid, it will be treated as 72 pixels per inch.
Default value is true.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.EpsEncoder._imageLocation
member.summary: This sets the relative location of the image in page space in units of points.

remarks.para: This sets where the image will be rendered on the virtual EPS page. In page space, the lower left corner of the page is (0, 0), as in a conventional Cartesian coordinate system. ImageLocation is the point at which the lower left corner of the image will be placed.
In EPS, the notion of a page doesn't fully apply, but since EPS can also be rendered on a PostScript device, if this point isn't chosen carefully, the image may get clipped.
By default, ImageLocation is (72, 72), or one inch up and to the right of the lower left corner of a page.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.EpsEncoder._scale
member.summary: Sets the output scale of the image.

remarks.para: Use this to change the scale of the image in the EPS image. It is initially set to (1, 1), which represents no change in scale. To reduce the image, set this property to values less than 1 but greater than 0. To enlarge the image, set this property to values greater than 1.
Scale does not need to be uniform. In other words, an image can be enlarged in either the x or y directions independently.
Negative values will flip the image as well as scale it.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.EpsEncoder._creator
member.summary: Set the title of the image in the EPS header
member.remarks: Default value is "Untitled"

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.EpsEncoder._title
member.summary: Set the title of the image in the EPS header
member.remarks: Default value is "Untitled"

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.EpsEncoder._invertBW
member.summary: Switches the sense of black and white in 1 bit-per-pixel images
member.remarks: Default value is true.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.EpsEncoder._ignoreColorProfile
member.summary: Allow the EPS encoder to ignore the color profile provided by an image.
member.remarks: If IgnoreColorProfile is set to false and the image contains a color profile, the resulting EPS will contain an embedded color profile. If IgnoreColorProfile is set to true the color profile will be ignored.

remarks.para: By default, when opening a Gif image using the or objects, this decoder will automatically be selected from the and does not have to be explicitly set.

summary.para: An used to read Compuserve Graphics Interchange (GIF) images from a .

example.code:
' Open the file for reading. Dim fs As FileStream = New FileStream(Me.fileName,FileMode.Open,FileAccess.Read)
' Make sure it's a valid GIF. Dim gif As GifDecoder = New GifDecoder() If gif.IsValidFormat(fs) = False Then fs.Close() Return End If
' Seek back to the beginning of the file. fs.Seek(0, SeekOrigin.Begin)
' The first time you access the GetFrameCount property, ' all of the frames are read into memory and are waiting ' for you to access them. Dim count As Integer = gif.GetFrameCount(fs)
' Use the GifFrame properties to reconstruct the animation. Dim col As GifFrameCollection = gif.Frames
' Close the file. fs.Close()

summary.para: An that will write Compuserve Graphics Interchange (GIF) images to a .

remarks.para: This can be passed into the the or objects when saving to specify a GIF image.
Gif Images typicaly have one color which is transparent. When saving with a GifFrameCollection object, this is indicated by the TransparentIndex property of each GifFrame.

When saving with a regular AtalaImage or ImageCollection, the transparent index is determined automaticaly. Each color in the palette can have an alpha value between 0 and 255. The GifEncoder will chose (as the transparent color) the first fully transparent color in the palette, that is the first color with an alpha value of 255.

example.code:
Private Sub CreateAnimatedGif(ByVal fileName As String, ByVal images As ImageCollection) ' Find the maximum size of the animation. Dim width As Integer = 0 Dim height As Integer = 0 Dim img As AtalaImage For Each img In images If img.Width > width Then width = img.Width End If
If img.Height > height Then height = img.Height End If Next
' Create the frame collection. Dim col As GifFrameCollection = New GifFrameCollection() col.Width = width col.Height = height col.LoopCount = 0 ' infinite col.TransparentIndex = -1 ' no transparency
' Center each image. Dim img As AtalaImage For Each img In images Dim frame As GifFrame = New GifFrame(img, New Point((width - img.Width) / 2,(height - img.Height) / 2)) col.Add(frame) Next
' Save the image. Dim fs As FileStream = New FileStream(fileName,FileMode.Create,FileAccess.Write) Dim encoder As GifEncoder = New GifEncoder() encoder.Save(fs, col, Nothing) fs.Close()
' Free the collection. col.Dispose() End Sub

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the image is saved with a pixel row interlacing pattern. Default false
member.remarks: Interlacing is a technique that allows a Gif to be displayed gradually. It first displays a blocky image which becomes finer and more clear as the image loads.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.ImageDecoder
member.summary: An abstract (MustInherit in Visual Basic) base class that defines a file format decoder to read an image from a Stream. All image decoders used in dotImage must inherit this class.
member.remarks: To load an image from a stream, the constructor may be used, and passing in a string filename, or a Stream. See the examples below

example.para: Load an image from a Stream

code.title: Load an image from a Stream (C#)

example.code: FileStream fs = System.IO.File.OpenRead(@"c:\test.tif"); AtalaImage image = new AtalaImage(fs);

code.title: Load an image from a Stream (Visual Basic)

example.code: Dim fs As FileStream = System.IO.File.OpenRead("c:\test.tif") Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage(fs);
example.para: Load an image from a file

code.title: Load an image from a file (C#)

example.code: AtalaImage image = new AtalaImage(@"c:\test.tif");

code.title: Load an image from a file (Visual Basic)

example.code: Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("c:\test.tif");

member.summary: This interface is applied to ImageDecoders that have the ability to decode an image stream to a specified scale.
member.remarks: Decoders that apply this interface are capable of reading extremely large images without loading the full size image into memory.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.IScaledDecoder.GetBestScale(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: If the codec can efficiently generate a scaled image without actually resampling, this will return the closest scale given an input scale factor.
member.remarks: This is most useful for images that have multiple resolutions stored within. JPEG's can quickly generate a scaled image 1/2, 1/4, 1/8, and 1/16 the original size and thus will return one of these sizes.
member.returns: The closest stored scale greater than or equal to the requested scale.
member.param: The encoded image stream
The zero based frame index if the source image is multiframed
The scale to request

The zero based frame index if the source image is multiframed
The scale factor to request (ie. 0.5 is 1/2 scale, 1 is full scale)
The progress callback

summary.para: An used to read JPEG images from a .

remarks.para: By default, when opening a Jpeg image using the or objects, this decoder will automatically be selected from the %RegisteredDecoders% and does not have to be explicitly set.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegEncoder.SetDownsamplingFactors(System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Sets the downsampling factors used when compressing the image data. This will affect both quality and file size of the saved image.

remarks.para: The horizontal and vertical arrays represent the factors for each color channel. If the image is 8-bit there should only be a single element in the array. For 24-bit images there will be three elements.
The values of these factors range from 1 to 4, but not all value combinations will work. Those that do not work will throw an exception when saving the image.

example.code:
Dim encoder As JpegEncoder = New JpegEncoder(90) Dim factors() As Integer = New Integer() {1, 1, 1} encoder.SetDownsamplingFactors(factors, factors)
Dim fs As FileStream = New FileStream(filename, FileMode.Create, FileAccess.Write) encoder.Save(fs, Image, Nothing) fs.Close()

member.param: An array of horizontal factors used. This can be null (Nothing in VB) to use the default settings. See remarks below for more information.
An array of vertical factors used. This can be null (Nothing in VB) to use the default settings. See remarks below for more information.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegEncoder.CopyJpegWithNewMarkers(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: These methods perform a lossless copy of the JPEG image data into a new image while replacing the JPEG metadata with new metadata.
member.remarks: By saving the APP1 Jpeg marker, EXIF, IPTC, and COM data can be copied to existing images, without the need to recompress the image data. This method does not overwrite existing JPEG images, but creates a copy of the existing JPEG data. The original image could be deleted if this method succeeds.
member.param: The source image filename to copy from.
The destintation image filename to copy to.
member.overloads: These methods perform a lossless copy of the JPEG image data into a new image while replacing the JPEG metadata with new metadata.
member.remarks: By saving the APP1 Jpeg marker, EXIF, IPTC, and COM data can be copied to existing images, without the need to recompress the image data. This method does not overwrite existing JPEG images, but creates a copy of the existing JPEG data. The original image could be deleted if this method succeeds.

example.code: Dim iptc As IptcCollection = new IptcCollection() iptc.Add(New IptcTag(2, 25, 0, "Testing CopyJpegMarkers")) Dim fsIn As FileStream = New FileStream("myimageIn.jpg", FileMode.Open, FileAccess.Read) Dim fsOut As FileStream = New FileStream("myimageOut.jpg", FileMode.Create, FileAccess.Write) Dim jpeg As JpegEncoder = New JpegEncoder() jpeg.IptcTags = iptc jpeg.CopyJpegWithNewMarkers(fsIn, fsOut) fsIn.Close() fsOut.Close()

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.PngDecoder.screenGamma
member.summary: Gets or sets the screen gamma value that will be used to adjust the colors of a PNG image when read if the image contains gamma.
member.remarks: A value of 0 will ignore the gamma of the image. A value of 2.2 is typical for PC's. Default 0.
member.value: The screen gamma value that will be used to adjust the colors of a PNG image when read if the image contains gamma.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.PngDecoder.twoBytePerComponentSupport
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether 16-bit per component images are read as 16 or 8-bit per component images.
member.value: A value indicating whether 16-bit per component images are read as 16 or 8-bit per component images.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.PngDecoder._setAlphaFromTransparentColor
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the PngDcoder should set the alpha channel in the image using the Png file's transparent color.
member.value: Returns true if the decoder should set the alpha channel, false otherwise. Default value is false.
member.remarks: GetImageInfo will always return the pixel format appropriate to the file without alpha. If the SetAlphaFromTransparentColor is true, the returned image may be in a different pixel format. For example, an image with a pixel format of Pixel24BppBgr will be Pixel32BppBgra if SetAlphaFromTransparentColor is true and there is a transparent color in the png.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.RegisteredDecoders._decoders
member.summary: Gets a static collection of Image Decoders that will be used to decode any arbitrary image.
member.remarks: Add any custom decoders to this collection so that the AtalaImage constructor and Workspace.Open will use that decoder when attempting to load an image. member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Tiff.TiffDirectory
member.summary: Represents a single TIFF page.
member.remarks: A TiffDirectory represents a single page in a . It can be constructed by the TiffFile class internally, returning an object that contains all the TIFF tags with no binary image data, or it can be constructed by the developer and represent actual image data and tag information that will be saved into an existing TiffFile.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Tiff.TiffDirectory._exifTags
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of EXIF Tags that will be saved with the image.
member.remarks: See ExifParser for obtaining EXIF Tags from a TIFF (or JPEG) image. When this property is set, the subsequent will store the EXIF information contained within this property to the file.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Tiff.TiffDirectory._allowVitalTagChanges
member.summary: Sets or gets a flag determining if changes should be allowed in vital TIFF tags.
member.value: True if client code is allowed to change vital tags

remarks.para: When certain tags are modified indiscriminantly, it is possible to permanently damage a TIFF file. In dotImage 5.0 and earlier, it was not possible to modify these tags as doing so was considered an error.
In the 6.0 and above, these tags are now accessible. The list of vital tags includes:
Strip Byte Counts, Strip Offsets, Tile Byte Counts, Tile Offsets, Bits Per Sample, Rows Per Strip

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Tiff.TiffDirectory.Tags
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects associated with the image.
member.value: A representing all TIFF Tags in the image.

remarks.para: WARNING!!!

TIFF Tags can be edited, added, and removed using this collection property. However the developer is expected to have full understanding of the TIFF specification. Editing tags in ways that are not supported by the TIFF specification can create a corrupt file.
For example, changing the ImageWidth, ImageHeight, Compression, Photometric, and others to an unexpected value will result in a corrupt TIFF file.
When reading TIFF Tags, the TiffFile stream must remain open to read some tags that are populated only when accessing the Data property.

example.para: Displays all TIFF Tags from a TIFF document.
example.code: Dim file As TiffFile = New TiffFile() Dim fs1 As Stream = New FileStream("file1.tif", FileMode.Open, FileAccess.Read, FileShare.Read) Try file.Read(fs1) ForEach image As TiffDirectory In file.Images ForEach tag As TiffTag In image.Tags Console.WriteLine(tag.ToString()) Next Next Finally fs1.Close() End Try
example.para: Adds a new ImageDescription tag to a TIFF File.
example.code: Dim file As TiffFile = New TiffFile("multi.tif") file.Images(0).Tags.Add( _ New TiffTag(TiffTagID.ImageDescription, _ "Created with the DotImage Example Code", _ TiffTagDataType.Ascii)) file.Save("multi_newtag.tif")

member.exception: Thrown when the TiffFile's stream is closed when accessing a tag that is originally loaded as a data pointer. This usually is the case for string and binary data.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Tiff.TiffFile
member.summary: TiffFile is a class that allows access to a TIFF image file directly, without loading the image into memory. It represents a single TIFF document which can contain multiple pages.

example.para: Add an arbitrary TIFF tag.
example.code: ' open a TiffFile Dim oneTiff As TiffFile = New TiffFile() oneTiff.Read(streamOne) ' access to a TiffDirectory Dim image As TiffDirectory = oneTiff.images(0) ' access to TiffTagCollection Dim tags As TiffTagCollection = image.Tags ' add Tiff Tags (add copy-right) Tags.Add(33432, "DotImage") ' add Tiff Tags Dim datetime As String = "2005:07:26 09:31:23" Tags.Add(306, datetime, TiffTagDataType.Ascii) ' save oneTiff.Save(targetStream)
example.para: Demonstrates how to insert a page into an existing TIFF
example.code: Dim fs As Stream = New FileStream("1_multi.tif", FileMode.Open, FileAccess.Read, FileShare.Read) Dim tFile As TiffFile = New TiffFile() tFile.Read(fs) Dim tImage As TiffDirectory = New TiffDirectory( _ New AtalaImage(100, 100, PixelFormat.Pixel24bppBgr), _ TiffCompression.JpegCompression) tFile.Images.Insert(1, tImage) tFile.Save("multi_.tif") File.Delete("multi.tif") System.IO.File.Move("multi_.tif", "multi.tif")

member.name: E:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Tiff.TiffFile.CodecError
member.summary: This event is used by the TiffFile object to report errors that occur when parsing a TiffDirectory.
member.remarks: The DotImage Tiff decoder is aggressive in suppressing errors encountered while parsing damaged or somewhat malformed Tiff files. Normally these errors are not reported. This event provides a mechanism for an application to record, report, or abort in the event of an error.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Tiff.TiffDocument
member.summary: The TiffDocument class is used to represent an entire TIFF file in a way that makes it convenient to manipulate the pages of the document. Pages can be reordered, inserted, added, and removed. The final document can then be saved to a new file. TiffDocument keeps as little in memory at one time as possible.
member.remarks: When saving, TiffDocument does not recompress image data.

member.param: The non-null path to the file to be saved. The Save method to a path does not check to see if the output path is the same as any of the input paths. If it is, the results will be unpredictable and most likely will result in a damaged TIFF file.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Tiff.TiffPage
member.summary: An object that represents a page within a .

overloads.summary: Constructs a new TiffPage object from an AtalaImage

remarks.para: New TiffPage objects can't be constructed from streams or files. To get a single page from an existing stream, create a TiffDocument object from that stream and get the appropriate TiffPage from the document's Pages property.
Internally, this creates a MemoryStream representing a new single page TIFF file with the given image. It will be compressed with the supplied compression scheme (or default if none supplied).
After the TiffPage object is constructed, it no longer needs the original image and the client code is free to dispose it.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.RenderingIntent
member.summary: Indicates different methods to create a color rendering as defined by the International Color Consortium (ICC).
member.remarks: See http://msdn.microsoft.com for more information on rendering intents.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.RenderingIntent.Pictures
member.summary: Known as perceptual intent in the ICC specification, causes the full gamut to be compressed or expanded to full the gamut of the destination device. Most suitable for photographic images and is usually the default intent.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.RenderingIntent.Proof
member.summary: Known as the colorimetric intent in the ICC specification, causes colors that fall outside the range of the output device to be set to the nearest color while leaving the other colors unchanged. Does not preserve the white point and is commonly used for proofing printed material.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.RenderingIntent.Graphics
member.summary: Known as the Saturation intent in the ICC specification, it preserves the saturation of colors as the expense of hue and lightness. Commonly used for business graphics.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ColorManagement.RenderingIntent.Match
member.summary: Known as the absolute colorimetric intent in the ICC specification, causes colors that fall outside the range of the output device to be set to the nearest color while leaving the other colors unchanged. Preserves the white point.

summary.para: A color profile that is used for translating colors.

remarks.para: Currently, dotImage will read and embed a color profile into a JPEG, TIFF, or PNG image. The profile is used when converting to different color spaces such as CMYK to RGB and RGB to CMYK.
See www.color.org for a detailed explanation of the ICC and color profiles.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.Canvas
member.summary: This class is used to draw primitives and text onto an AtalaImage, Bitmap, or Graphics object.

remarks.para: To use the canvas class, create an instance specifying the object that will be drawn on in the constructor. If you're using the WorkspaceViewer WinControl, you will have to invoke ClearCache to show the changes to the image.

The drawing class has some advantages over using the Graphics object in GDI+. You may draw directly onto grayscale, colormapped, and 1-bit document images. In addition, you can choose the border color and line type with an AtalaPen, and if the drawing entity supports it, a Fill to use to fill the inside of the entity. The various Fill objects can be used for solid, hatched, gradient, or textured filled areas for both the border and inside of the entity.
A can be specified in the canvas object which can be configured to enable antialising of the drawn objects.
In addition, when drawing onto a graphics object, you may specify an inverted pen, using the XOR algorithm when drawing any entity onto the device. This property is ignored

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.Canvas.invertedOnGraphics
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if entities being drawn on a graphics object will be inverted.
member.value: A value indicating if entities being drawn on a graphics object will be inverted.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true will cause the pixels beneath the entity to be negated with the XOR algorithm. This is useful when drawing rubber-bands that can quickly be erased be drawing over the same location twice. The selection rectangle in the WinForm Viewport control by default draws on an inverted canvas.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.Canvas.smoothingLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of antialiasing applied to the entity being drawn onto this canvas.

remarks.para: Smoothing only works on continuous tone images (grayscale, RGB, or RGBA generally) and will be ignored with colormapped images. By default, all canvas objects start with a smoothing level of 0. The greater the smoothing level the more washed out the entity being drawn will appear. There is no upper limit to the smoothing level but it must be greater than or equal to zero.

member.value: The amount of antialiasing applied to the entity being drawn onto this canvas.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.Canvas._fontQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the quality for font rendering.
member.value: The rendering quality of the font.
member.remarks: ClearType is only available on Windows XP and above.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.Canvas.DrawText(System.String,System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Font,Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.Fill)
member.summary: Draw a single line text string onto this canvas specifying the upper left corner position.
member.param: The text string to draw.
The position of the upper left corner of the text rectangle to draw.
The text font.
The text fill.
member.returns: The actual size of the text drawn.

example.code:
' Load the image to work with. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg")
' Create a Canvas for this image. Dim canv As Canvas = New Canvas(image)
' Setup the text font options. Dim fnt As Font = New Font("Verdana", 36, FontStyle.Bold)
' Find out the rendered size of the text. Dim textSize As Size = Canvas.CalculateTextSize("%%company%% DotImage", fnt)
' Draw the text centered on the image. Dim pt As Point = New Point((image.Width - textSize.Width) / 2,(image.Height - textSize.Height) / 2) canv.DrawText("%%company%% DotImage", pt, fnt, New SolidFill(Color.Red), New SolidFill(Color.Transparent))

member.remarks: By default, text is drawn relative to the system DPI. To draw text relative to another DPI, such as the image DPI, see the property of .

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.FontQuality
member.summary: Font quality style when using the DrawText method.
member.remarks:
The following situations do not support ClearType antialiasing:
Text is rendered on a printer.
Display set for 256 colors or less.
Text is rendered to a terminal server client.
The font is not a TrueType font or an OpenType font with TrueType outlines. For example, the following do not support ClearType antialiasing: Type 1 fonts, Postscript OpenType fonts without TrueType outlines, bitmap fonts, vector fonts, and device fonts.
The font has tuned embedded bitmaps, for any font sizes that contain the embedded bitmaps. For example, this occurs commonly in East Asian fonts.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.FontQuality.Default
member.summary: Appearance of the font does not matter. System settings will determine its quality.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.FontQuality.Draft
member.summary: Appearance of the font is less important than when Proof is used. For raster fonts, scaling is enabled, which means that more font sizes are available, but the quality may be lower. Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized if necessary.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.FontQuality.Proof
member.summary: Character quality of the font is more important than exact matching of the logical-font attributes. For raster fonts, scaling is disabled and the font closest in size is chosen.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.FontQuality.NonAntialiased
member.summary: Font is never antialiased.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.FontQuality.Antialiased
member.summary: Font is always antialiased if the font supports it and the size of the font is not too small or too large.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.FontQuality.ClearType
member.summary: If set, text is rendered (when possible) using ClearType antialiasing method. Windows XP or above is requred.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Drawing.TextFormat.scaleToDpi
member.summary: Causes text to be drawn relative to the specified DPI.

remarks.para: When drawing text on a canvas, the text will be drawn relative to the system's DPI by default. To draw text relative to the DPI of the canvas's target surface, set this property to the target surface's DPI.
The target surface DPI can be found in the property for sources, and can be created from the DpiX and DpiY properties of sources.

member.value: The DPI value to scale drawn text to.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of the color data for each pixel in the image.

remarks.para: The pixel format defines the number of bits of memory associated with one pixel of data. The format also defines the order of the color components within a single pixel of data.
Many of the pixel formats are identical to the GDI+ System.Drawing.PixelFormat types. DotImage is compatible with some of the GDI+ formats as well as including a few others not compatible with GDI+.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel1bppIndexed
member.summary: One bit per pixel. A two color palette defines the colors associated with bit values of 0 and 1.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel4bppIndexed
member.summary: Four bits per pixel. A 16 color palette defines the colors associated with each pixel.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel8bppIndexed
member.summary: Eight bits per pixel. A palette of up to 256 colors may be used. Can contain alpha palette values.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel24bppBgr
member.summary: Twenty-four bits per pixel with pixel channels containing Blue, Green, and Red values in that order. This is also called an RGB image despite the order of the channels.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel32bppBgra
member.summary: Thirty-two bits per pixel with pixel channels containing Blue, Green, Red, and Alpha values in that order. This is also called an RGBA image despite the order of the channels.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel32bppBgr
member.summary: Thirty-two bits per pixel with pixel channels containing Blue, Green, and Red values in that order. This is also called an RGB image despite the order of the channels. The last channel is unused.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel8bppGrayscale
member.summary: Eight bits per pixel. Each pixel is a shade of gray, from 0 (black) to 255 (white).

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel16bppGrayscaleAlpha
member.summary: Sixteen bits per pixel. A standard grayscale palette is used where pal(0)=RGB(0,0,0) up to pal(255)=RGB(255,255,255). The second channel contains an alpha (transparency) value for each pixel.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel32bppCmyk
member.summary: Thirty-Two bits per pixel with pixels containing the colors Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, and Black. This is a subtractive colorspace with 0, 0, 0, 0 corresponding to pure white and 255, 255, 255, 255 corresponding to pure black.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel16bppGrayscale
member.summary: Sixteen bits per component. This format allows for greater detailed grayscale images. Each pixel can have a value from 0 (black) to 65535 (white).

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel48bppBgr
member.summary: Fourty-Eight bits per pixel with pixel channels containing Blue, Green and Red. This is a two byte per component image with values ranging from 0 to 65535 for each color component.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat.Pixel64bppBgra
member.summary: Sixty-Four bits per pixel with pixel channels containing Blue, Green, Red and Alpha values in that order. This is a two byte per component image with values ranging from 0 to 65535 for each color component.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ResolutionUnit
member.summary: Defines the units associated with Resolution, or Dpi.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ResolutionUnit.Undefined
member.summary: Units are not defined.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ResolutionUnit.DotsPerInch
member.summary: Units are expressed in inches.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ResolutionUnit.DotsPerCentimeters
member.summary: Units are expressed in centimeters.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.PaletteType
member.summary: Contains the standard palette types that a palette can be set to.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PaletteType.Grayscale
member.summary: The standard grayscale palette with gray colors. Entry 0 corresponds to Black and entry 255 corresponds with white, with gray shades between.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PaletteType.Web
member.summary: A palette where each primitive is a multiple of 51. (0, 51, 102, 153, 204, 255). With six possible values per primitive and 3 primitives (red, green and blue) the maximum colors are 216. (6^3=216)

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PaletteType.SixteenColor
member.summary: Standard windows 16 color palette.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PaletteType.BlackAndWhite
member.summary: Two color black and white palette

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.PaletteType.WebExtended
member.summary: Includes all colors of the 215 color web palette with the addition of 40 grayscale colors.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventHandler
member.summary: Handles the progress event for operations.
member.remarks: The progress callback can be handled to show progress while an image is being loaded, saved, or processed. Current and Total usually signifies the image row in pixels. When downloading a file, Current and Total represents the number of bytes. It can also be used to cancel the current action. When handling a progress event, the percentage can be calculated by dividing Current by Total. Some actions will cause multiple progresses (0 - 100%) to be called.
member.param: The object raising the event.
The ProgressEventArgs for this event.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.TernaryRasterOperations
member.summary: Enumeration for the raster operations used in BitBlt. In C++ these are actually #define. But to use these constants with C#, a new enumeration type is defined.

summary.para: This class allows you to post data to a server without user interaction.
The data is posted as if it were being sent from an HTML Form, allowing any form handling component to be used on the server.

example.code:
' Load the image we want to upload. Dim bmp As Bitmap = New Bitmap("C:\myimage.jpg")
' We are going to save the image as JPEG on the server. Dim post As HttpPost = New HttpPost(System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat.Jpeg) post.FormData.Add("image1", bmp, "myimage.jpg")
' Now lets add the additional information set by the client. post.FormData.Add("comment", Me.textComment.Text) post.FormData.Add("author", Me.textAuthor.Text)
' Upload the image and check the return value to see if it worked. Dim retVal As String = post.PostData("http://www.mysite.com/handleupload.aspx") If retVal <> "Success" Then MessageBox.Show(this, retVal, "Upload Error") End If
' Free the image. bmp.Dispose()
example.para: This example will show you how to acquire an image from a web page and post it to the server.
example.code:
<!-- The main Acquisition object. -->
<object id="Twain" height="1" width="1" classid="Atalasoft.Imaging.dll#Atalasoft.Imaging.Acquisition" VIEWASTEXT>
</object>

<!-- Create an instance of the HttpPost object -->
<object id="PostIt" height="1" width="1" classid="Atalasoft.Imaging.dll#Atalasoft.Imaging.HttpPost" VIEWASTEXT>
</object>

...

<script type="text/javascript">
var count = 0;
function AcquireImage()
{
    // Acquire the image.
    var img = document.Twain.AcquireModal(false);
    if (img == null)
    {
        alert('Image was not acquired.');
        return;
    }
            
    // Send the image to the server.
    count++;
    var filename = 'image' + count + '.png';
    document.PostIt.FormData.AddFromBrowser('postImage', img, filename);
            
    var response = "";
    //response = document.PostIt.PostDataFromBrowser('http://www.atalasoft.com/Components/Twain/Demo/savepost.aspx');
    response = document.PostIt.PostData('http://localhost/TwainDemo/savepost.aspx');
    
    // Free the form data.
    document.PostIt.FormData.Clear();
    
    // Update the image.
    if (response.length > 0)
    {
        var el = document.getElementById('preview');
        el.src = response;
    } else {
        alert("PostDataFromBrowser failed");
    }
}
</script>

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageMemory

summary.para: This class handles memory associated with an image. It controls how the memory is allocated and freed. Use this class to enable memory file mapping.

member.remarks: File Mapped memory can greatly increase performance when working with extremely large images or when system resources are limited.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ApplyPaletteCommand
member.summary: Summary description for ApplyPaletteCommand.
member.remarks: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will raise the ChangePixelFormat event and convert the image to a continuous tone format, which can be 8-bit grayscale, RGB, or RGBA.
member.summary: Maps an image into a specified palette, creating an 8-bit colormapped image.
member.remarks: This command uses various dithering algorithms to create a colormapped image that can very closely represent a full color image. A containing up to 256 colors can be applied.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ApplyPaletteCommand.palette

summary.para: Gets or sets the Palette to map the image to.

member.value: The Palette to map the image to.
member.remarks: The palette must be set before invoking ApplyToImage.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ApplyPaletteCommand.ditherMode

summary.para: Gets or sets the dithering mode to use when mapping the image to a palette.

member.value: The dithering mode to use when mapping the image to a palette.
member.remarks: Default value is DitheringMode.None.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ApplyPaletteCommand.ditherErrorMax
member.value: The amount of dithering.
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of dithering to apply.

remarks.para: Valid values are between 0 and 127 with 0 being little to no dithering and 127 the full amount of possible dithering. Defaults to 127.
For converting a color or grayscale image to 1-bit black and white without dithering, see the , , and .

member.exception: Thrown if the value is less than 0 or greater than 127.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ApplyPaletteCommand.VerifyProperties(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Verify the integrity of properties in the command before processing an image.
member.param: The image to be processed.
member.exception: Palette;The palette must be set before calling Apply.

remarks.para: This method does not check the integrity of the source image itself. That is already done by the time VerifyProperties is called.
Errors should be indicated by throwing an appropriate exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ApplyPaletteCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ApplyPaletteCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.summary: Performs the actual command.
member.param: The source.

The area.
The results.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangePixelFormatCommand.VerifyProperties(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Verify the integrity of properties in the command before processing an image.
member.param: The image to be processed.
member.exception: Source and destination pixel formats cannot be equal

remarks.para: This method does not check the integrity of the source image itself. That is already done by the time VerifyProperties is called.
Errors should be indicated by throwing an appropriate exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ChangePixelFormatCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.AdjustChannelCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.
member.exception: This pixel format is not supported.;image

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.ApplyLutCommand
member.summary: Apply a Look-Up-Table to an image. A Look-Up-Table is an array of 256 byte values which are used to substitute for the image pixel data. This allows you to modify each pixel component value.
member.remarks: This command will not work on 1-bit or 4-bit images.

example.code:
' Load a 24-bit image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("in.jpg")
' Create a negative LUT. Dim lut(255) As Byte For i As Integer = 0 To 255 lut(i) = 255 - i Next
' Apply this LUT to the Blue and Red channels. Dim cmd As ApplyLutCommand = New ApplyLutCommand(lut, Nothing, lut) Dim results As ImageResults = cmd.Apply(image) results.Image.Save("out.jpg", New Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegEncoder(), Nothing)
