summary.para: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.

member.returns: A new object that is a copy of this instance.

remarks.para: Clone can be implemented either as a deep copy or a shallow copy. In a deep copy, all objects are duplicated; whereas, in a shallow copy, only the top-level objects are duplicated and the lower levels contain references.
The resulting clone must be of the same type as or a compatible type to the original instance.

member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.FlattenAlphaCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

summary.para: Use this command to invert the image.

remarks.para: Uses a highly optimized invert routine on RGB images when AllChannels are included. You may specify any or all channels to invert.
Inverting an image creates a photo negative by subtracting 255 from each channel value.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.ReplaceChannelCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.ReplaceChannelCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

summary.para: This command will create an alpha channel for an image based on a color value. If the image already contains alpha information, the color will be blended into it.

remarks.para: This method will convert 1-bit, 4-bit and 8-bit grayscale images to 8-bit indexed. 24-bit images will be converted to 32-bit.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.SetAlphaColorCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.
member.exception: unable to construct destination image

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.SetAlphaFromMaskCommand

summary.para: Creates an alpha channel for an image using an 8-bit grayscale mask image to control transparency.

member.remarks: This command will result in a 16-bit grayscale-alpha or 32-bit RGBA image.

example.code:
' Load a 24-bit image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg")
' Load the 8-bit grayscale mask. Dim mask As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\JPG\8-bit alpha mask.jpg")
' Apply the mask to the image and create the new 32-bit image. Dim cmd As SetAlphaFromMaskCommand = New SetAlphaFromMaskCommand(mask, True, AlphaMergeType.UseMostTransparent) Dim result As AtalaImage = cmd.Apply(image).Image
' Free the image and mask. image.Dispose() mask.Dispose()

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.SetAlphaFromMaskCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.SetAlphaFromMaskCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.SetAlphaValueCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.
member.exception: Unable to construct a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.SetAlphaValueCommand.Apply(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Apply the command to the given image.
member.param: The image which will by processed by the command.
member.returns: A new object of type .
member.remarks: The ImageResults object will always contain a valid Image property which represents the output of the command. This property may be the same as the input image.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.SetAlphaValueCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.ShiftChannelsCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Channels.SwapChannelsCommand
member.summary: Swaps one channel with another channel within the same image.

remarks.para: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will throw the
This command requires an image with at least 2 channels. If the image does not contain at least 2 channels, the PixelFormat will be changed to a compatible format.

example.code:
' Load a 24-bit image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg")
' Swap the Red and Green channels. ' Remember, the image data is stored in BGR (Blue, Green, Red) format. Dim cmd As SwapChannelsCommand = New SwapChannelsCommand(1,3,2) Dim tmp As AtalaImage = cmd.Apply(image).Image

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdaptiveThresholdCommand

remarks.para: The AdaptiveThresholdCommand can be used to cleanup a color or grayscale image when converting to black and white. It results in an image that generally renders text and objects intact, while removing effects from color shades.

Like global thresholding, adaptive thresholding is used to separate desirable foreground image objects from the background. This is based on the difference in pixel intensities of each region, while global thresholding uses a fixed threshold for all pixels and therefore works only if the intensity histogram of the input image contains obviously separated peaks corresponding to the desired subjects and backgrounds. Hence it cannot deal with images containing, for example, a strong illumination gradient. Local adaptive thresholding selects an individual threshold for each pixel. This allows for thresholding of an image whose global intensity histogram doesn't contain distinctive peaks.

member.summary: An ImageCommand used to convert a grayscale or color image into black and white using a weighted thresholding technique.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdaptiveThresholdCommand._differenceThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets a value used for improving the thresholding results.
member.remarks: In local adaptive thresholding, an individual threshold for each pixel is based on the range of intensity values in its local neighborhood. In this class, a local mean value is used as the threshold. The situation can be improved if the threshold employed is not the mean, but "mean - DifferenceThreshold". The default value is 7.
member.value: A value used for improving the thresholding results.

member.summary: Gets or sets the size of local window acting on each pixel to find local statistics.
member.remarks: Default value is 15.
member.value: The size of local window acting on each pixel to find local statistics.
member.exception: Thrown if value is 2.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdaptiveThresholdCommand.ConstructChangedSourceImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: The method is called by the default implementation of Apply. It determines if it is necessary to create a copy of the source image in a different pixel format and if so, determines the best new pixel format and allocates that image.
member.param: The original source image passed to Apply.
member.returns: A new image in a pixel format supported by the command or null to indicate that the original image is acceptable.

remarks.para: The default implementation of ConstructChangedSourceImage requests that the command report its preferred pixel format (typically, this is the source image's pixel format, but some commands support many pixel formats, but work best in gray, for example), and if that is supported, returns a new image in the preferred format if it is different from the source image.

If the pixel format is not supported and ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to true, the command is queried for its best alternate pixel format and a new image is returned in that pixel format. If ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to false, ConstructChangedSourceImage will throw an IncompatiblePixelFormatException.
If an error occurs, ConstructChangedImage should throw an exception. Any new image constructed by ConstructChangedImage must be a pixel format supported by this command.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoDeskewCommand
member.summary: The AutoDeskewCommand automatically deskews a binary image using %%company%%'s patent pending auto-deskew algorithm.

remarks.para: This command works best with images containing horizontal text.

There are a few ways to improve performance. Decrease the and or pass in a smaller rectangular area containing the horizontally aligned text area. The property can be decreased to increase performance, however it will result in loss accuracy. For guaranteed accuracy, set the Coverage property to 100.
The property is set to the last detected skew angle. See to determine the skew angle without actually rotating the image.

As of 6.0 AutoDeskewCommnd now additionally supports the following image formats: ,
, , and .

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoDeskewCommand.area
member.summary: Gets or sets rectangular area that will be used for determining the skew angle.
member.value: The rectangular area that will be used for determining the skew angle.
member.remarks: This value by default is Rectangle.Empty and will use the entire image for calculating the angle.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoDeskewCommand.precision
member.summary: Gets or sets the precision of the de-skew angle calculation.
member.value: The precision of the de-skew angle calculation.
member.remarks: This value is the inverse of the smallest angle increment that it will find. For example, a value of 1 = 1 degree precision, 2 = 1/2 degree precision, 4 = 1/4 degree precision, etc. The smaller the value the more time it takes to calculate the de-skew angle. The default value is 2 (or 1/2 a degree).
member.exception: Thrown if the value is less than 1.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoDeskewCommand.limitAngle
member.value: The maximum skew angle in degrees.
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum skew angle in degrees.
member.remarks: Decreasing this value improves performance, while increasing improves the chance that a drastically skewed image will be straightened. The default value is 20 degrees.
member.exception: Thrown when value is not between -360 and 360 or is equal to 0.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoDeskewCommand.cropMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the method of cropping the resulting de-skewed image.
member.value: A value indicating the method of cropping the resulting de-skewed image. The default value is FullCrop.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoDeskewCommand.backgroundColor
member.value: The background color to use when de-skewing the image.
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color to use when de-skewing the image.
member.remarks: The background color is only relevant when the CropMode is set to None or OriginalSize. The default value is White.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoDeskewCommand.coverage
member.summary: Represents the percentage of the image that will be randomly sampled when determining the skew angle.
member.value: A value representing the percent of coverage from 0 to 100.

remarks.para: Given the random nature of the coverage, low values result in must faster performance than 100% coverage with generally the same results. A default value of 8 was derived after tests with many images. This results in accurate skew angle detection with fast speed. This property is exposed for edge cases where 8 is not sufficient. When accuracy is of utmost importance at the expense of speed, set this value to 100.

member.exception: Thrown if the value is less than 0 or greater than 100.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BorderRemovalCommand
member.summary: An ImageCommand that removes solid borders from document images.

remarks.para: This command can be used to remove black solid borders from the edges of images. A of 0 will only work with perfect solid borders. Use a tolerance between 0 and 100 to account for minor noise in the border. Set Edges is true, the image will be despeckled prior to calculating the border, only if the image is binary. Note that the image that's returned from Apple will not be despeckled, only the image used in the calculation.
To calculate the border of the image, without cropping, use the method. GetBorder ignores the Edges property and returns the border from all sides.

example.code: Dim cmd As New BorderRemovalCommand() Dim results As BorderRemovalResults = CType(cmd.Apply(sourceImage), BorderRemovalCommandResults) Dim newImage As AtalaImage = results.Image Dim borderRect As Rectangle = results.Border If (Not results.IsImageSourceImage) Then sourceImage.Dispose() 'free memory End If

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BorderRemovalCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BorderRemovalCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BorderRemovalCommand.ConstructImageResults
member.summary: Constructs the results object for this command.
member.returns: A new object of type ImageResults representing the results for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns an object of type ImageResults. If your command requires an object with more information, subclass ImageResults and add in the information you need. Your command will override ConstructImageResults and return your new object.
The object allocated here is passed to PerformActualCommand as a reference parameter, meaning the entire object can be changed at that point too.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BorderRemovalCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.DitheringMethod
member.summary: Specifies the technique used for dithering in a .

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.DitheringMethod.FloydSteinberg
member.summary: Use Floyd-Steinberg error diffusion

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.DitheringMethod.Ordered
member.summary: Use matrix-based ordered dithering

summary.para: This command is used for converting color or gray images to black and white using halftoning techniques to simulate gray in the final image. This command operates best on photographic images.
Dithering is done using either Ordered Dithering or Floyd-Steinberg Error Diffusion dithering.
With Ordered Dithering, the dithering matrix is fully replaceable and can be made to simulate custom halftone screens.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.DocumentHitOrMissCommand
member.summary: Perform a hit-or-miss transformation on a binary image.

remarks.para: Hit or Miss is a basic tool for finding geometric shapes within an image. The masks used determine the shapes that are detected.
The foreground mask operates on foreground features and the background mask on background features. Together they detect foreground-background transitions in the input image.
The two masks used are normally the same size and must contain mutually-exclusive elements: if a mask position in A contains a 1, the corresponding position in B must contain a 0.
For example, these masks will find vertical edges on the left sides of the foreground image.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.DocumentThinningCommand
member.summary: Apply morphological thinning to a 1-bit image.

remarks.para: This will reduce the geometric size of an image, leaving only a skeletonized frame behind.
This function requires two sets of masks. The foreground masks represents foreground matching masks and the background masks should be the compliments of the foreground masks. (swap ones and zeros).
A typical set of foreground masks is:
The background masks are compliments of these (1 and 0 reversed).
Note that the content of each mask is the preceding mask, rotated 45 deg.
The process works by applying each of these masks in pairs (A[x], B[x]) for all pairs, until MaxIterations has been reached or until there is no change in the image. This can be a long process.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.DynamicThresholdCommand._differenceThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets a value used to improving the thresholding results.
member.remarks: In local adaptive thresholding, an individual threshold for each pixel is based on the range of intensity values in its local neighborhood. In this class, a local mean value is used as the threshold. The situation can be improved if the threshold employed is not the mean, but "mean - DifferenceThreshold". The default value is 7.

Errors should be indicated by throwing an appropriate exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.DynamicThresholdCommand.ConstructChangedSourceImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: The method is called by the default implementation of Apply. It determines if it is necessary to create a copy of the source image in a different pixel format and if so, determines the best new pixel format and allocates that image.
member.param: The original source image passed to Apply.
member.returns: A new image in a pixel format supported by the command or null to indicate that the original image is acceptable.

remarks.para: The default implementation of ConstructChangedSourceImage requests that the command report its preferred pixel format (typically, this is the source image's pixel format, but some commands support many pixel formats, but work best in gray, for example), and if that is supported, returns a new image in the preferred format if it is different from the source image.

If the pixel format is not supported and ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to true, the command is queried for its best alternate pixel format and a new image is returned in that pixel format. If ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to false, ConstructChangedSourceImage will throw an IncompatiblePixelFormatException.
If an error occurs, ConstructChangedImage should throw an exception. Any new image constructed by ConstructChangedImage must be a pixel format supported by this command.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.DynamicThresholdCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.GlobalThresholdCommand
member.remarks: Global thresholding is the simplest of all thresholding techniques. It will partition the image histogram by using a single global threshold. Segmentation is then accomplished by scanning the image pixel by pixel and labelling each pixel as object or background. The success of this method depends entirely on how well the histogram can be partitioned.
member.summary: An ImageCommand used to convert a grayscale or color image into black and white using a global thresholding technique.

example.code: Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage(....) Dim gtm As GlobalThresholdCommand New GlobalThresholdCommand() Dim segmentedImage As AtalaImage = gtm.Appy(image).Image image.Dispose()

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.GlobalThresholdCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.GlobalThresholdCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.GlobalThresholdCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ResampleDocumentCommand.VerifyProperties(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Verify the integrity of properties in the command before processing an image.
member.param: The image to be processed.
member.exception: You must provide a destination size.;destSize or Cannot perform AreaAverage resize method when increasing the size of the image,\nuse BiLinear or the scale to gray default instead. or Cannot perform EnlargeFast resize method when decreasing the size of the image,\nuse BiLinear, AreaAverage, or ScaleToGray instead.

remarks.para: This method does not check the integrity of the source image itself. That is already done by the time VerifyProperties is called.
Errors should be indicated by throwing an appropriate exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ResampleDocumentCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ResampleDocumentCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.SimpleThresholdCommand
member.summary: This command converts a continuous RGB or grayscale image to a 1-bit black and white image, given a threshold value.
member.remarks: SimpleThresholdCommand can result in considerably better performance over the method in or ApplyPaletteCommand when converting color or grayscale images to black and white. however the quality of the conversion can vary, and offers no dithering.

member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold value.
member.remarks: This is the value from 0 - 255 of which any pixel that with a brightness greater then the value will be converted to white, and any pixel with a brightness less than this value will be converted to black. Default value is 127.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.SimpleThresholdCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.AdjustTintCommand

summary.para: Adjusts the tint of an image by specifying a value.

member.remarks: This method requires an RGB or RGBA image. It will throw the if it is not RGB or RGBA

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.AdjustTintCommand.tint
member.summary: Gets or sets a value from -180 to +180. Positive values enhance green, negative values enhance red.
member.value: A value from -180 to +180. Positive values enhance green, negative values enhance red.
member.exception: Thrown if value is not between -180 and 180.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.AdjustTintCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by Apply may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.AutoWhiteBalanceCommand
member.summary: Automatically adjusts the white point in an image.
member.remarks: Auto White Balance is based on "Gray World" algorithm and balances the source image. It is best applied after the translation to gamma-corrected RGB space.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the amount of dampening to use.
member.value: The amount of dampening.
member.remarks: Dampening is used to mitigate the algorithm since full correction is often too extreme for real world scenes.
member.exception: Thrown when value amp;lt; 1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.AutoWhiteBalanceCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.value: The amount of dampening.
member.remarks: Dampening is used to mitigate the algorithm since full correction is often too extreme for real world scenes.
member.exception: Thrown when value < 1.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.BevelEdgeCommand

summary.para: Apply a bevel effect to the edges of an image.

member.remarks: This method requires a continuous tone image.

example.code:
' Load a 24-bit image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg")
' Apply a 10 pixel bevel with a light source from the right. Dim cmd As BevelEdgeCommand = New BevelEdgeCommand(10,60,170,200,40,200) cmd.Apply(image)

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.BevelEdgeCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.BrightnessHistogramEqualizeCommand
member.summary: Perform histogram equalization on an image while preventing colors from shifting.

remarks.para: This function will re-distribute the pixel values across the given range so that there will be (approximately) equal numbers of pixels with each pixel value (0 to 255). Input pixels with values above or below the threshold values are not modified in the output.
Can be used to extend the dynamic range of an image.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.BrightnessHistogramStretchCommand
member.summary: Performs a histogram stretch on an image while preventing colors from shifting.

remarks.para: Re-distribute the pixel values across the given range by first setting values above and below the thresholds to zero and 255 respectively and then scaling the remaining values to span the entire zero to 255 range.
This can be used to increase the contrast and extend the dynamic range of an image.

member.exception: Thrown if value is not between 0 and 100.

member.exception: Thrown if value is not between 0 and 100.

member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.CrackleCommand

summary.para: Generates an image which looks like a cracked ceramic glaze.

member.remarks: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will raise the ChangePixelFormat event and convert the image to a compatible format.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.CrackleCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

summary.para: Applies a color curve to an image, similar to the Photoshop Curves method.
The curves are defined by an array of one or more objects.

example.code:
' Load an image. Dim myImage As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("C:\\mytestimage.jpg")
' Apply a simple curve. Dim points() As PointF = New PointF(1) {} points(0) = New PointF(0.3, 0.6) points(1) = New PointF(0.6, 0.8)
Dim cmd As CurvesCommand = New CurvesCommand(points,ChannelFlags.AllChannels) cmd.Apply(myImage)

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.CurvesCommand._points
member.summary: Gets or sets the points that define the curve.
member.value: The points that define the curve.

remarks.para: At least one point must be provided, with a maximum of 256 points.
Each point value must have a range from 0.0 to 1.0. There can be no duplicate PointF.X values can be in the array.

member.exception: Occurs if null is passed as the points parameter or if an empty array is passed in.
Occurs if the array has more than 256 elements or a duplicate X value was found.
Occurs if the points array contains invalid values.

member.value: The channels to process.

summary.para: This command will de-interlace an image.

remarks.para: Interlacing is when two frames, usually in video, are mixed together in one frame with odd lines being from one frame and even lines being from the other frame. De-Interlacing can fix this with one of three options:

OL.LI: Merging the odd and even lines

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.DeInterlaceCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.DropShadowCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.DropShadowCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.DropShadowCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.FloodFillCommand
member.summary: Performs a flood fill on an image. You can use it to fill an area of an image surrounded by FillColor by setting Mode to Edge, or you can fill the pixel color at Position with FillColor.

remarks.para: This command requires one of the following image formats:
If any other image format is passed, you will receive a System.ArgumentException.

example.code:
Dim rc As Rectangle
If Me.viewer.Selection.Visible Then rc = Me.viewer.Selection.Bounds Else rc = New Rectangle(PoInteger.Empty, Me.viewer.Image.Size) End If
Dim pos As Point = New Point(rc.Width / 2 + rc.Left, rc.Height / 2 + rc.Top) Dim cmd As FloodFillCommand = New FloodFillCommand(pos, Color.Red, 5, ColorMatchMode.Surface) cmd.RegionOfInterest = New RegionOfInterest(rc)
Me.viewer.ApplyCommand(cmd)

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.FloodFillCommand.position
member.summary: Gets or sets the X, Y pixel position where the fill should start.
member.value: The X, Y pixel position where the fill should start.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.FloodFillCommand.tolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of color variation.
member.value: The percentage of color variation.
member.remarks: Valid values are 0 to 100. A value of 0 requires an exact color match, where a value of 100 will match any color.
member.exception: Thrown if value is not between 0 and 100.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.FloodFillCommand.fillColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the Color used for the fill.
member.value: The color used for the fill.

remarks.para: If is Edge, this color also represents the the edge color and will fill the area until it finds the edge color.
If Mode is Surface, this color will be used to fill the pixel color located at until it reaches a different color.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.FloodFillCommand.mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the ColorMatchMode used for the fill.
member.value: The ColorMatchMode used for the fill.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.FloodFillCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.GammaCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.GauzyCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.HistogramEqualizeCommand

remarks.para: This function will re-distribute the pixel values across the given range so that there will be (approximately) equal numbers of pixels with each pixel value (0 to 255). Input pixels with values above or below the threshold values are not modified in the output.
Can be used to extend the dynamic range of an image.
This command processes the image In-Place.

member.summary: Performs histogram equalization on an image.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.HistogramStretchCommand

remarks.para: Re-distribute the pixel values across the given range by first setting values above and below the thresholds to zero and 255 respectively and then scaling the remaining values to span the entire zero to 255 range.
This can be used to increase the contrast and extend the dynamic range of an image.

member.summary: Performs a histogram stretch on an image.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.HistogramStretchCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.summary: Gets or sets a bit flag indicating the channels to process.
member.value: A bit flag of changes to process.

member.summary: Gets or sets the percent of pixels to set to 0.

member.remarks: Valid values are from 0 to 100. The sum of HighLimit and LowLimit must not exceed 100.
member.exception: Thrown if value is not between 0 and 100.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.MosaicCommand

summary.para: Generate a mosaic (large pixel) image.

member.remarks: This method requires a 24 or 32 bit image. If the source image is not continuous, it will throw the

example.code:
' Load the image to work with. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1save.jpg")
' Apply a mosaic effect to the middle of the image. Dim rc As Rectangle = New Rectangle(20,20,image.Width - 40,image.Height - 40) Dim mos As MosaicCommand = New MosaicCommand(10) mos.RegionOfInterest = New RegionOfInterest(rc) mos.Apply(image)

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.PosterizeCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.RedEyeRemovalCommand
member.summary: Attempts to eliminate "red-eye" from a region of an RGB image.
member.remarks: You must select an "eye" region from the image, then choose a saturation level and color range. These should be done interactively, as the color and saturation of the "red-eye" effect varies greatly between images. See the Rubberbanding features in WinControls for selecting the eye region.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.ReduceColorsCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.RoundedBevelCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.RoundedBevelCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.ScribbleCommand.ConstructChangedSourceImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: The method is called by the default implementation of Apply. It determines if it is necessary to create a copy of the source image in a different pixel format and if so, determines the best new pixel format and allocates that image.
member.param: The original source image passed to Apply.
member.returns: A new image in a pixel format supported by the command or null to indicate that the original image is acceptable.

remarks.para: The default implementation of ConstructChangedSourceImage requests that the command report its preferred pixel format (typically, this is the source image's pixel format, but some commands support many pixel formats, but work best in gray, for example), and if that is supported, returns a new image in the preferred format if it is different from the source image.

If the pixel format is not supported and ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to true, the command is queried for its best alternate pixel format and a new image is returned in that pixel format. If ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to false, ConstructChangedSourceImage will throw an IncompatiblePixelFormatException.
If an error occurs, ConstructChangedImage should throw an exception. Any new image constructed by ConstructChangedImage must be a pixel format supported by this command.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.ScribbleCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.SolarizeCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.StippleCommand.ConstructChangedSourceImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: The method is called by the default implementation of Apply. It determines if it is necessary to create a copy of the source image in a different pixel format and if so, determines the best new pixel format and allocates that image.
member.param: The original source image passed to Apply.
member.returns: A new image in a pixel format supported by the command or null to indicate that the original image is acceptable.

remarks.para: The default implementation of ConstructChangedSourceImage requests that the command report its preferred pixel format (typically, this is the source image's pixel format, but some commands support many pixel formats, but work best in gray, for example), and if that is supported, returns a new image in the preferred format if it is different from the source image.

If the pixel format is not supported and ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to true, the command is queried for its best alternate pixel format and a new image is returned in that pixel format. If ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to false, ConstructChangedSourceImage will throw an IncompatiblePixelFormatException.
If an error occurs, ConstructChangedImage should throw an exception. Any new image constructed by ConstructChangedImage must be a pixel format supported by this command.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.StippleCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Effects.WatercolorTintCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ResampleMethod.Default
member.summary: Uses a predefined resampling method depending on the image PixelFormat and final size. Uses Nearest Neighbor resampling for 1-bit and 8-bit colormapped images, BiLinear when increasing the size of continuous tone images. and AreaAverage when reducing continuous tone images.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ResampleMethod.BiLinear

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ResampleMethod.BiCubic

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ResampleMethod.AreaAverage

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FftCommand
member.summary: The base class used for all FFT (Fast Fourier Transform) filters for frequency domain image processing.
member.remarks: Includes the method ApplyToGrid which allows multiple FFT filters to be applied without converting back and forth to the frequency domain. Can also be used normally with the ApplyToImage method for processing a single FFT filter.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FftCommand.VerifyProperties(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Verify the integrity of properties in the command before processing an image.
member.param: The image to be processed.

remarks.para: This method does not check the integrity of the source image itself. That is already done by the time VerifyProperties is called.
Errors should be indicated by throwing an appropriate exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FftCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FftCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.summary: Returns an array of PixelFormats supported by this command.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.FftGrid
member.summary: The FftGrid is used as an intermediate step in FFT processing. It transforms a grayscale image into the FFT domain, and is required prior to all FFT filters.
member.remarks: When using the Grid as the intermediate step, multiple FFT filters can be applied. Each FFT Command has an ApplyToGrid method that uses an FftGrid to process. Once the image has completed processing, be sure to return the changed image with the GetProcessedImage method.

example.code:
' Load an 8-bit grayscale image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\JPG\8-bit alpha mask.jpg")
' Resize the image so its width and height are a power of 2. Dim NewSize As Size = New Size(FftGrid.GetNextPowerOfTwo(image.Width),FftGrid.GetNextPowerOfTwo(image.Height)) Dim resample As ResampleCommand = New ResampleCommand(NewSize) Dim temp As AtalaImage = resample.ApplyToImage(image) image.Dispose()
' Create an FftGrid from the image and apply a filter to it. Dim grid As FftGrid = New FftGrid(temp) Dim cmd As ButterworthHighPassFftCommand = New ButterworthHighPassFftCommand(1.2,2.4) cmd.ApplyToGrid(grid)
' Get the resulting image. Me.viewer.Image = grid.GetProcessedImage() temp.Dispose()

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Fft.IdealHighPassFftCommand
member.summary: The ideal high pass filter zeros out all frequencies inside a specified cutoff radius.
member.remarks: High pass filters clip low frequencies tending to sharpen images. Ideal filters use a strict cutoff, tending to cause a ringing effect when converted back to the spatial domain. This "ringing" is similar to how JPEG's generate artifacts at sharp color changes. In practice, Ideal filters are rarely used due to this side effect.

summary.para: Uses a powerful technique for sharpening images in the presence of low noise levels via an adaptive filtering algorithm.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AdaptiveUnsharpMaskCommand.threshold

summary.para: Gets or sets a value controlling the depth of the effect.

value.para: A value controlling the depth of the effect.

member.exception: Thrown if value is not between 0 and 255.

remarks.para: Any value between 0 and 255 is valid. The lower the value, the greater the effect.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AdaptiveUnsharpMaskCommand.amount
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of the sharpened signal to add to the output image.,
member.value: The amount of the sharpened signal to add to the output image.

remarks.para:
0 = no change,
1 = full change
You can use any number (even negative), but the intended use is between 0 and 1.

member.summary: Verify the integrity of properties in the command before processing an image.
member.param: The image to be processed.
