member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AdaptiveUnsharpMaskCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AdaptiveUnsharpMaskCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.summary: Add different types of noise to an image.
member.remarks: See the Workspace or WorkspaceViewer for applying this command to an image.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AddNoiseCommand.channelsToProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets a bit flag indicating the channels to process.

remarks.para: Only the fourth channel can be set using this flag. By default, with a value of 0, the fourth channel is ignored for RGBA images.

member.value: The type of noise to apply.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value controlling the intensity.
member.value: A value controlling the intensity.
member.remarks: There is no upper limit to this value. A good value to start with is around 500.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than 0.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AddNoiseCommand.monochromatic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that when true applies the same noise equally to each channel.
member.value: A value that when true applies the same noise equally to each channel.
member.exception: Thrown if value is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AddNoiseCommand.mean
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which adds additional noise to the output for Gaussian and Uniform noise types.
member.value: A value which adds additional noise to the output for Gaussian and Uniform noise types.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than 0.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AddNoiseCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.BlurCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.BlurCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.BlurGaussianCommand
member.summary: Performs a Gaussian blur filter on the image. This has a more dispersed effect then the traditional blur filter, but slower.
member.remarks:
This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will raise the ChangePixelFormat event and convert the image to a continuous tone format, which can be 8-bit grayscale, RGB, or RGBA.
Our ActiveX version, ImgX, uses Intensity for this method where Intensity = (sigma - 0.5) * 100. A good value to start with is around 2.0.
member.summary: Performs a Gaussian blur filter on the image. This has a more dispersed effect then the traditional blur filter, but slower.
member.remarks:
This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will raise the ChangePixelFormat event and convert the image to a continuous tone format, which can be 8-bit grayscale, RGB, or RGBA.
Our ActiveX version, ImgX, uses Intensity for this method where Intensity = (sigma - 0.5) * 100. A good value to start with is around 2.0.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.BlurGaussianCommand.sigma
member.summary: Gets or sets the standard deviation of the gaussian kernal, controlling the amount of blur.
member.remarks: Good values to start with are between 0.6 and 2.4. The higher the value the greater the blur depth and longer the processing time.
member.value: The standard deviation of the gaussian kernal, controlling the amount of blur.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than 0.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.CannyEdgeDetectorCommand
member.summary: Find edges in an image using the Canny algorithm.

example.code:
' Load a 24-bit image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg")
' Apply the command. Dim cmd As CannyEdgeDetectorCommand = New CannyEdgeDetectorCommand(1.1,30,20) Dim result As AtalaImage = cmd.Apply(image).Image
image.Dispose()

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.CannyEdgeDetectorCommand.sigma
member.summary: Gets or sets the standard deviation of the gaussian kernal.
member.value: The standard deviation of the gaussian kernal.
member.remarks: Good values to start with are between 0.6 and 2.4. Higher values increase processing time.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than 0.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.CannyEdgeDetectorCommand.lowHysteresis
member.summary: Gets or sets a value used to specify the low hysteresis value.
member.value: A value used to specify the low hysteresis value.
member.remarks: This is a percentage of the computed high threshold edge strength value. Good starting values are between 20 and 50.
member.exception: Thrown if value is not between 0 and 100.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.CannyEdgeDetectorCommand.highHysteresis
member.remarks: This fraction (0 to 100) specifies the percentage point in a histogram of the gradient of the magnitude. Magnitude values of zero are not counted in the histogram. Good starting values are between 60 and 90.
member.summary: Gets or sets a value used to specify the high hysteresis value.
member.value: A value used to specify the high hysteresis value.
member.exception: Thrown if value is not between 0 and 100.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.ColorizeCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.ColorizeCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.ConvolutionFilterCommand
member.summary: Applies a custom Convolution Filter to an image.

remarks.para: This should only be used on continuous-tone images (RGBA, grayscale, RGB, etc.).
If Traditional is true, this can be used to do things like a Gaussian blur, etc., depending on the matrix used.
The number of columns and the number of rows in the matrix must both be odd.
The filter is applied as follows :

DIV.para: M = matrix ( 3 x 3, in this example)
The matrix is centered on the current pixel. In this example, M[4] is the center of the matrix.
P = pixels . Since the matrix is centered on the current pixel, P(x,y), the pixels used in this calculation will be :
t = sum ( M[i] * P[i] ) [for all elements of the matrix]

remarks.para: Matrix M in this example demonstrates the sharpening filter used by this library, if bTraditional is FALSE.
Besides the ability to use matricies of arbitrary size, this object differs from %ConvolutionMatrixCommand% in the way the final calculation is performed.

member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.ConvolutionMatrixCommand
member.summary: Applies a custom Convolution Matrix to an image.

remarks.para: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will raise the ChangePixelFormat event and convert the image to a continuous tone format, which can be 8-bit grayscale, RGB, or RGBA.

The matrix is an array of 9 doubles, arranged as : ,
,

,
where "4" is the source pixel. ,
,
It is applied for pixel(x,y) as : ,
,
Step 1 ,
double tempSum = ( ,
pMatrix[0] * pixel(x-1, y-1) + ,
pMatrix[1] * pixel(x, y-1) + ,
pMatrix[2] * pixel(x+1, y-1) + ,
pMatrix[3] * pixel(x-1, y ) + ,
pMatrix[4] * pixel(x, y ) + ,
pMatrix[5] * pixel(x+1, y ) + ,
pMatrix[6] * pixel(x-1, y+1) + ,
pMatrix[7] * pixel(x, y+1) + ,
pMatrix[8] * pixel(x+1, y+1)); ,
,
Step 2 ,
if doFeedback = true,
tempSum = pixel(x,y) * (1.0 - k) + (k * tempSum);,
else,
tempSum = tempSum * k; ,
,
where k is the intensity,
,
Step 3 ,
tempSum = min(tempSum, 255); ,
,
Step 4 ,
tempSum = max(tempSum, 0); ,
,
Step 5 ,
outval = tempSum;

member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.DustAndScratchRemovalCommand.VerifyProperties(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Verify the integrity of properties in the command before processing an image.
member.param: The image to be processed.

remarks.para: This method does not check the integrity of the source image itself. That is already done by the time VerifyProperties is called.
Errors should be indicated by throwing an appropriate exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.DustAndScratchRemovalCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.DustAndScratchRemovalCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.DustAndScratchRemovalCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.EmbossCommand
member.summary: Applies an embossing filter to the source image.

example.code:
' Load a 24-bit image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg")
' Apply the command. Dim cmd As EmbossCommand = New EmbossCommand(135,60,4,True) Dim result As AtalaImage = cmd.Apply(image).Image
image.Dispose()

member.summary: The type of morphological filter to use in the .

summary.para: Used to smooth small dark regions tending to enhance black features in the image.
Used to smooth small light regions tending to reduce black features in the image.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MorphoGrayMode.Open
member.summary: The dilation of the erosion of the image used to reduce small black regions within the image.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MorphoGrayMode.Close
member.summary: The erosion of the dilation of the image used to reduce small white regions within the image.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MorphoGrayMode.Tophat
member.summary: Used to enhance low-contrast, high frequency details within an image.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MorphoGrayMode.Gradient
member.summary: Highlights sharp gray-level transitions (edges) in an image.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanFilterType
member.summary: Various types of MeanFilter.
The type of mean filter to apply.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanFilterType.Arithmetic
member.summary: Finds average values under the filter.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanFilterType.Geometric
member.summary: Removes Gaussian type noise from an image better than the arithmetic mean filter. Unlike the YP mean filter, this is susceptible to low-valued outliers: a zero pixel under the filter will cause the filter to output zero.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanFilterType.Harmonic
member.summary: Removes Gaussian type noise from an image better than the arithmetic mean filter. It is good at removing positive outliers, but it is susceptible to low-valued outliers: a zero pixel under the filter will cause the filter to output zero.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanFilterType.YP
member.summary: A non-linear mean filter which is better at removing Gaussian type noise and preserving edge features than the basic arithmetic mean filter. It is also very good at removing outliers (positive or negative, depending on the order of the filter) from images.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AddNoiseFilterType
member.summary: The type of noise to add to an image.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AddNoiseFilterType.Gaussian
member.summary: A type of noise whose histogram is bell-shaped: most of the noise will occur in the middle of the pixel value range, and less noise will occur at the extremes.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AddNoiseFilterType.Negative
member.summary: Negative Exponential Noise.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AddNoiseFilterType.Rayleigh
member.summary: Rayleigh noise.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AddNoiseFilterType.Uniform
member.summary: Uniform Noise.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AdaptiveUnsharpQuality
member.summary: Indicates the quality level in the %AdaptiveUnsharpMaskCommand%.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AdaptiveUnsharpQuality.Low
member.summary: Less accurate results, but very fast.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AdaptiveUnsharpQuality.Middle
member.summary: Good results, slower to process.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.AdaptiveUnsharpQuality.High
member.summary: Highest quality with the best results. Very slow.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.HighPassCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.HighPassCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.IntensifyCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MaximumCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

summary.para: Applies an Arithmetic, Harmonic, Geometric, or Yp mean filter to an image.

remarks.para: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will raise the ChangePixelFormat event and convert the image to a continuous tone format, which can be 8-bit grayscale, RGB, or RGBA.
Mean filtering is a simple method of smoothing images (reducing the amount of intensity variation between one pixel and the next) and often used to reduce noise.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanCommand.ChannelsToProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets a bit flag indicating the channels to process.
member.value: A bit flag indicating the channels to process.
member.remarks: A value of 0 or AllChannels will process each channel in the image.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanCommand.MeanType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of mean filter to apply.
member.value: The type of mean filter to apply.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than 0.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanCommand.FilterSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the filter.
member.value: The size of the filter.
member.remarks: Should be an odd value (3, 5, 7, 9, etc.). The larger the value, the greater the effect at the expense of speed. An even value will be incremented by 1.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than 0.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanCommand.Power
member.summary: Gets or sets the a non-zero integer that controls power for the Yp mean filter.
member.remarks:
Ignored if meanType is not MeanFilterType.Yp.,
power lt; 0, removes positive outliers ,
power gt; 0, removes negative outliers
member.value: A non-zero integer that controls power for the Yp mean filter.
member.exception: Thrown if value is equal to 0.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanCommand.VerifyProperties(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Verify the integrity of properties in the command before processing an image.
member.param: The image to be processed.

remarks.para: This method does not check the integrity of the source image itself. That is already done by the time VerifyProperties is called.
Errors should be indicated by throwing an appropriate exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MeanCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MedianCommand

summary.para: Reduces noise in an image, similarly to the mean filter, however doing a better job preserving useful detail in the image.

member.remarks: A value of 0 or AllChannels will process each channel in the image. For document images, please see DocumentMedianCommand instead.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MedianCommand.channelsToProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets a bit flag indicating the channels to process.
member.value: A bit flag indicating the channels to process.
member.remarks: A value of 0 or AllChannels will process each channel in the image.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MedianCommand.filterSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the matrix.
member.value: The size of the matrix.
member.remarks: The filter size should be an odd value. The larger the value, the greater the effect at the expense of speed. An even value will be incremented by 1.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than 0.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.MorphoGrayCommand
member.summary: Applies a morphological Erosion, Dilation, Open, Close, or TopHat to a grayscale image.

remarks.para: Morphology is the study of form and structure. In image processing, it encompasses a set of techniques that merge traditional image processing with set theory from mathematics.

member.exception: Thrown if the matrix does not have an equal number of rows and cols.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.

member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.SharpenCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.SharpenCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.ThresholdCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.UnsharpMaskCommand
member.remarks: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will raise the event and convert the image to a continuous tone format, which can be 8-bit grayscale, RGB, or RGBA.
member.summary: The unsharp mask is a sharpening filter which derives its name from the fact that it enhances edges and other high frequency components in an image via a procedure which subtracts an unsharp, or gaussian blurred, version of an image from the original image. The unsharp mask filter is commonly used in the photographic and printing industries for crispening edges.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.UnsharpMaskCommand.threshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of threshold
member.value: Controls the depth of the effect; the lower the value, the greater the effect. Any value between 0 and 255 is valid.
member.exception: Thrown if value is not between 0 and 255.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.UnsharpMaskCommand.amount
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of amount
member.value: Controls the intensity of the effect. Values should be between 0.0 (no effect) and 1.0 (full effect). Higher values will give unpredictable results.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than 0.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.UnsharpMaskCommand.sigma
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of sigma
member.value: The standard deviation (sigma) of the gaussian kernal, controlling the amount of blur. Good values to start with are between 0.6 and 2.4. The higher the value the greater the blur depth and longer the processing time.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Filters.UnsharpMaskCommand.channelsToProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets the ChannelFlags specifying which channels to process.
member.value: The ChannelFlags specifying which channels to process.
member.remarks: The default value is AllChannels.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Histogram
member.summary: Summary description for Histogram.

summary.para: This command is used to represent the number of unique color channel values or brightness values be returning an array containing the number of pixels at the value signified by the array index.

member.remarks: For 8-bit per component images, the array contains 256 values. 16-bit per component images returns an array of 65536 values.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Histogram.GetDocumentHistogram
member.summary: Returns a two element array containing the number of black and white pixels in a binary image.
member.exception: Thrown if the image pixelformat is other than Pixel1bppIndexed.
Thrown if the image is null.
Thrown is the current license is not DotImage Document Imaging.
member.remarks: In a typical binary image, the first pixel value is white, and second is black (known as MinIsWhite). Occassionally this is swapped. Check the palette index color value to be certain.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageCommand._applyToAnyPixelFormat
member.summary: Reports whether or not this command will be applied to any supplied PixelFormat image
member.value: When set to true, the command will perform automatic PixelFormat conversion of the source image to a PixelFormat suitable for the command. By default this property is set to false.

remarks.para: Note that not all commands will support this property. If a command returns true in the property CanApplyToAnyPixelFormat, then ApplyToAnyPixelFormat can be either true or false.
If a command reports false in the property CanApplyToAnyPixelFormat, then ApplyToAnyPixelFormat can only be false and will throw a NotSupportedException if set to true.

member.remarks: Many ImageCommands can be run in a multithreaded manner that will improve the performance of the command without affecting the output. Speed improvements are especially apparent on multicore processors.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageCommand.CanApplyToAnyPixelFormat
member.summary: Returns true if the command can be applied to any PixelFormat.

remarks.para: Many commands have the ability to take advantage of automatic PixelFormat conversion so that they can operate on all the PixelFormats instead of a select few. This capability comes at the cost of time and memory.

If CanApplyToAnyPixelFormat is true, then it is possible to set the property ApplyToAnyPixelFormat to true, to cause automatic conversion. If CanApplyToAnyPixelFormat is false, then it is incorrect to set ApplyToAnyPixelFormat to true.

member.value: A boolean representing if this command can be applied to any PixelFormat.

member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageCommand.ConstructChangedSourceImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: The method is called by the default implementation of Apply. It determines if it is necessary to create a copy of the source image in a different pixel format and if so, determines the best new pixel format and allocates that image.
member.returns: A new image in a pixel format supported by the command or null to indicate that the original image is acceptable.

remarks.para: The default implementation of ConstructChangedSourceImage requests that the command report its preferred pixel format (typically, this is the source image's pixel format, but some commands support many pixel formats, but work best in gray, for example), and if that is supported, returns a new image in the preferred format if it is different from the source image.

If the pixel format is not supported and ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to true, the command is queried for its best alternate pixel format and a new image is returned in that pixel format. If ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to false, ConstructChangedSourceImage will throw an IncompatiblePixelFormatException.
If an error occurs, ConstructChangedImage should throw an exception. Any new image constructed by ConstructChangedImage must be a pixel format supported by this command.

member.param: The original source image passed to Apply.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.LosslessJpeg
member.summary: Summary description for LosslessJpeg.
This class performs lossless transformations on JPEG images.

example.code:
' Load a JPEG image. Dim fs As FileStream = New FileStream("D:\Test Images\1.jpg", FileMode.Open,FileAccess.Read)
' See if the file can use the lossless transform. If LosslessJpeg.CanDoLosslessTransform(fs,JpegTransformType.Rotate90) Then Dim fsSave As FileStream = New FileStream("D:\Test Images\1transform.jpg", FileMode.Create, FileAccess.Write) fs.Seek(0, SeekOrigin.Begin) LosslessJpeg.Transform(fs, fsSave, JpegTransformType.Rotate90) fsSave.Close() Else ' Use the normal rotate command. fs.Seek(0, SeekOrigin.Begin) Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage(fs,Nothing)
Dim cmd As RotateCommand = New RotateCommand(90) Dim result As AtalaImage = cmd.ApplyToImage(image) result.Save("D:\Test Images\1transform.jpg",New JpegEncoder(85),Nothing)
image.Dispose() result.Dispose() End If
fs.Close()

' Load a JPEG image. Dim fs As FileStream = New FileStream("D:\Test Images\1.jpg", FileMode.Open,FileAccess.Read)
' See if the file can use the lossless transform. If LosslessJpeg.CanDoLosslessTransform(fs,JpegTransformType.Rotate90) Then Dim fsSave As FileStream = New FileStream("D:\Test Images\1transform.jpg", FileMode.Create, FileAccess.Write) fs.Seek(0, SeekOrigin.Begin) LosslessJpeg.Transform(fs, fsSave, JpegTransformType.Rotate90) fsSave.Close() Else ' Use the normal rotate command. fs.Seek(0, SeekOrigin.Begin) Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage(fs,Nothing)
Dim cmd As RotateCommand = New RotateCommand(90) Dim result As AtalaImage = cmd.ApplyToImage(image) result.Save("D:\Test Images\1transform.jpg",New JpegEncoder(85),Nothing)
image.Dispose() result.Dispose() End If
fs.Close()

remarks.para: JPEG images are compressed with lossy compression, meaning that each time the image is saved, quality is lost. Some operations, such as rotate, crop, and convert to grayscale can be performed without re-encoding the data.

Do determine of the image can be operated on losslessly, check the method. JPEG images are divided into rectangular sections called MCU blocks that are typically 8x8 pixels. If the width and height are both divisible by 8, then it usually means that lossless operations can be performed without losing or cropping the edges. However some JPEG images have MCU blocks other than 8.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.LosslessJpeg.Transform(System.String,System.String,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.JpegTransformType)
member.summary: Perform a lossless transform on a JPEG image.
member.exception: Thrown is the current license is not DotImage Photo Pro, or DotImage Document Imaging.
member.param: The source image file.
The destination image filename.
The transform type to apply.
member.summary: Perform a lossless transform on a JPEG image.

remarks.para: This can be used to perform one of a set of simple transformations without decompressing the JPEG data. By not decompressing, you don't have to re-compress, thus avoiding adding additional JPG artifacts to the output image.

This works by rearranging the compressed data (DCT coefficients), without ever fully decoding the image. Therefore, its transformations are lossless: there is no image degradation at all, which is not the case if you were to read the image to RGB, transform, and save again as JPG.

The transpose transformation has no restrictions regarding image dimensions. The other transformations operate rather oddly if the image dimensions are not a multiple of the iMCU size (usually 8 or 16 pixels, though sometimes 32 or 48), because they can only transform complete blocks of DCT coefficient data in the desired way.

The default behavior is to discard these "extra" blocks. This prevents ugly strips of unmodified data along one edge. So, strictly speaking, these transformations are not lossless for all images: they are lossless only for images with dimensions that are multiples of 8 or 16. You can override this discarding the extra blocks, though it is not recommended.

member.exception: Thrown is the current license is not DotImage Photo Pro, or DotImage Document Imaging.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.LosslessJpeg.Crop(System.String,System.String,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Performs a lossless crop on a JPEG image.
member.exception: Thrown is the current license is not DotImage Photo Pro, or DotImage Document Imaging.
member.param: The source image file.
The destination image filename.
The crop rectangle.
member.summary: Performs a lossless crop on a JPEG image.

remarks.para: Perform a lossless crop on the image in a JPG file, without decompressing the JPG data. By not decompressing, you don't have to re-compress, thus avoiding adding additional JPG artifacts to the output image.

This works by rearranging the compressed data (DCT coefficients), without ever fully decoding the image. Therefore, its transformations are lossless: there is no image degradation at all, which is not the case if you were to read the image to RGB, transform, and save again as JPG.

Note:,
JPG files are compressed in rectangular blocks. The dimensions of these blocks are always a multiple of 8 pixels: 8x8 and 16x16 are common.

Because the compression blocks on the top and left edges cannot be split during a crop, the size of these blocks affects the crops that this function can perform. This inability to split blocks means that the top-left corner of the crop rect you specify will always be rounded down to the next lowest multiple of the MCU size (see GetMcuBlackSize). The bottom right corner you specify is unaffected.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayCommand
member.summary: Summary description for tmpOverlay.
Overlays a specified image on top of the source image.

remarks.para: If the top image has an alpha channel, that alpha will be used to control the transparency of the overlay and will override the %TransparentColor% and %Opacity% values.
When overlaying one image with alpha, on top of another image with alpha, the alpha channels will be merged to take the maximum pixel value of each alpha channel. See for more specific options.
The top image will always be converted to the pixel format of the bottom image, unless the top image has an alpha channel, which it will then use for alpha blending.
This command supports all pixel formats with the exception of 4-bit Indexed.
This command processes the source image in-place, and ApplyToImage always returns null.

example.code:
Private Function OverlayImage(ByVal bottomFile As String, ByVal topFile As String, ByVal position As Point) As AtalaImage ' Make sure the files exist. If Not File.Exists(bottomFile) Then Throw New FileNotFoundException("The bottom image file could not be found.", bottomFile) End If
If Not File.Exists(topFile) Then Throw New FileNotFoundException("The file to overlay could not be found.", topFile) End If
' Load the bottom image. Dim tmpImage As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage(bottomFile)
' Overlay does not support 4-bit bottom images. Dim bottomImage As AtalaImage = Nothing If tmpImage.PixelFormat = PixelFormat.Pixel4bppIndexed Then bottomImage = tmpImage.GetChangedPixelFormat(PixelFormat.Pixel8bppIndexed) tmpImage.Dispose() Else bottomImage = tmpImage End If
' Load the top image. tmpImage = New AtalaImage(topFile)
' If the bottom image is 16-bit per component, the top image must be the same. Dim topImage As AtalaImage = Nothing If AtalaImage.PixelFormatIsTwoBytePerComponent(bottomImage.PixelFormat) And topImage.PixelFormat <> bottomImage.PixelFormat Then topImage = tmpImage.GetChangedPixelFormat(bottomImage.PixelFormat) tmpImage.Dispose() Else topImage = tmpImage End If
Dim cmd As OverlayCommand = New OverlayCommand(topImage,position) cmd.ApplyToImage(bottomImage)
' We are done with the top image. topImage.Dispose()
Return bottomImage End Function

Private Function OverlayImage(ByVal bottomFile As String, ByVal topFile As String, ByVal position As Point) As AtalaImage ' Make sure the files exist. If Not File.Exists(bottomFile) Then Throw New FileNotFoundException("The bottom image file could not be found.", bottomFile) End If
If Not File.Exists(topFile) Then Throw New FileNotFoundException("The file to overlay could not be found.", topFile) End If
' Load the bottom image. Dim tmpImage As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage(bottomFile)
' Overlay does not support 4-bit bottom images. Dim bottomImage As AtalaImage = Nothing If tmpImage.PixelFormat = PixelFormat.Pixel4bppIndexed Then bottomImage = tmpImage.GetChangedPixelFormat(PixelFormat.Pixel8bppIndexed) tmpImage.Dispose() Else bottomImage = tmpImage End If
' Load the top image. tmpImage = New AtalaImage(topFile)
' If the bottom image is 16-bit per component, the top image must be the same. Dim topImage As AtalaImage = Nothing If AtalaImage.PixelFormatIsTwoBytePerComponent(bottomImage.PixelFormat) And topImage.PixelFormat <> bottomImage.PixelFormat Then topImage = tmpImage.GetChangedPixelFormat(bottomImage.PixelFormat) tmpImage.Dispose() Else topImage = tmpImage End If
Dim cmd As OverlayCommand = New OverlayCommand(topImage,position) cmd.ApplyToImage(bottomImage)
' We are done with the top image. topImage.Dispose()
Return bottomImage End Function

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayMaskedCommand
member.summary: Overlay a specified image onto the source image using an 8-bit grayscale mask image to control the transparency of the overlay.

example.code:
Private Function OverlayImage(ByVal bottomFile As String, ByVal topFile As String, ByVal maskFile As String) As AtalaImage ' Make sure the files exist. If Not File.Exists(bottomFile) Then Throw New FileNotFoundException("The bottom image file could not be found.", bottomFile) End If
If Not File.Exists(topFile) Then Throw New FileNotFoundException("The file to overlay could not be found.", topFile) End If
If Not File.Exists(maskFile) Then Throw New FileNotFoundException("The mask file could not be found.", maskFile) End If
' Load the bottom image. Dim tmpImage As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage(bottomFile)
' Overlay does not support 4-bit bottom images. Dim bottomImage As AtalaImage = Nothing If tmpImage.PixelFormat = PixelFormat.Pixel4bppIndexed Then bottomImage = tmpImage.GetChangedPixelFormat(PixelFormat.Pixel8bppIndexed) tmpImage.Dispose() Else bottomImage = tmpImage End If
' Load the top image. tmpImage = New AtalaImage(topFile)
' If the bottom image is 16-bit per component, the top image must be the same. Dim topImage As AtalaImage = Nothing If AtalaImage.PixelFormatIsTwoBytePerComponent(bottomImage.PixelFormat) And topImage.PixelFormat <> bottomImage.PixelFormat Then topImage = tmpImage.GetChangedPixelFormat(bottomImage.PixelFormat) tmpImage.Dispose() Else topImage = tmpImage End If
' Load the mask image that will describe the alpha values. tmpImage = New AtalaImage(maskFile)
' The mask must be 8-bit grayscale. Dim mask As AtalaImage = Nothing If tmpImage.PixelFormat <> PixelFormat.Pixel8bppGrayscale Then mask = tmpImage.GetChangedPixelFormat(PixelFormat.Pixel8bppGrayscale) tmpImage.Dispose() Else mask = tmpImage End If
' The mask must also be the same size as the top image. If mask.Size <> topImage.Size Then Dim resample As ResampleCommand = New ResampleCommand(topImage.Size) tmpImage = resample.ApplyToImage(mask) mask.Dispose() mask = tmpImage End If
Dim cmd As OverlayMaskedCommand = New OverlayMaskedCommand(topImage,mask) cmd.ApplyToImage(bottomImage)
' We are done with the top image and mask. topImage.Dispose() mask.Dispose()
Return bottomImage End Function

remarks.para: If the top image already contains an alpha channel, use OverlayCommand, which will alpha blend the images automatically.
The bottom image must be a continuous format, such as 8-bit grayscale or 24-bit RGB. See OverlayMaskedDocumentCommand for masking 1-bit binary images.
This command processes the source image in-place, and ApplyToImage always returns null.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.OverlayMergedCommand
member.summary: Summary description for OverlayMergedCommand.
member.remarks: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will throw the

summary.para: Merge two images of the same PixelFormat together specifying various merge types.

remarks.para: This functionality is especially useful when combining alpha channels with options other than the default "maximum" used in the when overlaying two RGBA images.
This command processes the source image in-place, and ApplyToImage always returns null.

example.code:
' Load the images to work with. Dim bottomImage As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg") Dim topImage As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1save.jpg")
' Overlay the top image into the bottom image with 50% opacity. Dim cmd As OverlayMergedCommand = New OverlayMergedCommand(topImage,PoInteger.Empty, MergeOption.FastBlend, 0.5) cmd.ApplyToImage(bottomImage)

' Load the images to work with. Dim bottomImage As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg") Dim topImage As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1save.jpg")
' Overlay the top image into the bottom image with 50% opacity. Dim cmd As OverlayMergedCommand = New OverlayMergedCommand(topImage,PoInteger.Empty, MergeOption.FastBlend, 0.5) cmd.ApplyToImage(bottomImage)

member.summary: This object can be passed into most ImageCommands to indicate a region of the image to process. Any shaped region can be used by specifying a object or a simple .

example.code:
' Load the image to work with. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1save.jpg")
' Apply a mosaic effect to the middle of the image. Dim rc As Rectangle = New Rectangle(20,20,image.Width - 40,image.Height - 40) Dim mos As MosaicCommand = New MosaicCommand(10) mos.RegionOfInterest = New RegionOfInterest(rc) mos.ApplyToImage(image)

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ResampleColormappedToRgbCommand
member.summary: Summary description for ResampleColormappedToRgbCommand.
member.remarks: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will raise the ChangePixelFormat event and convert the image to a continuous tone format, which can be 8-bit grayscale, RGB, or RGBA.
member.summary: Resamples the source 8-bit colormapped image to a 24-bit RGB to a specified size.
member.remarks: This command is used when viewing a colormapped image in the controls when Antialiasing. It will smooth the lines and create better displays of colormapped images by efficiently converting the image from 8-bit colormapped to 24-bit RGB while it's resampling.

member.summary: Gets or sets the rectangular region of the source image that will be resized.
member.value: The rectangular region of the source image that will be resized.
member.remarks: The default value is Rectangle.Empty, in which case the entire image is resized.

member.summary: Gets or sets the final width and height of the image.
member.value: The final size of the image.
member.remarks: Ignored when the property is set to a value greater than 0.
member.exception: Thrown when the width or height is less than or equal to 0.

member.value: The resampling algorithn to apply.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum width or height value for resizing while maintaining the aspect ratio.
member.value: The width of height value for resizing while maintaining the aspect ratio.
member.remarks: When this value is 0 (the default), it is ignored and is used instead. Use this value to automatically calculate the new width and height, keeping the same aspect ratio as the original image.
member.exception: Thrown if the value is less than 0.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ResampleColormappedToRgbCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ResampleCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)

member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ThreadedCommand
member.summary: ThreadedCommand is a proxy command that will induce ImageCommands that support multithreading to run in on multiple threads.

remarks.para: Only ImageCommands that implement the IThreadableCommand and ICloneable interfaces can be used with ThreadedCommand. ThreadedCommand manages all thread creation and synchronization, proxy management of ImageCommand operations and so on.
Once a ThreadedCommand has been created and given a valid ImageCommand, it can be used any place that ImageCommand can be used.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ThreadedCommand._command
member.summary: Sets or gets the underlying command that will be multithreaded.
member.remarks: In addition to being an ImageCommand, the given command must implement the IThreadableCommand and ICloneable interfaces.

member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.
member.exception: ThreadedCommands can't be embedded in themselves.
source;cannot process a null image.
adjustedBands;an image cannot be processed with zero bands

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ThreadedCommand.ConstructChangedSourceImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: The method is called by the default implementation of Apply. It determines if it is necessary to create a copy of the source image in a different pixel format and if so, determines the best new pixel format and allocates that image.
member.param: The original source image passed to Apply.
member.returns: A new image in a pixel format supported by the command or null to indicate that the original image is acceptable.

remarks.para: The default implementation of ConstructChangedSourceImage requests that the command report its preferred pixel format (typically, this is the source image's pixel format, but some commands support many pixel formats, but work best in gray, for example), and if that is supported, returns a new image in the preferred format if it is different from the source image.

If the pixel format is not supported and ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to true, the command is queried for its best alternate pixel format and a new image is returned in that pixel format. If ApplyToAnyPixelFormat is set to false, ConstructChangedSourceImage will throw an IncompatiblePixelFormatException.
If an error occurs, ConstructChangedImage should throw an exception. Any new image constructed by ConstructChangedImage must be a pixel format supported by this command.

member.summary: Returns the InPlaceProcessing value of the underlying command.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ThreadedCommand.GetChangedPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat)
member.summary: This method is called to change the pixel format of the source image.
member.param: The original source image.
The new pixel format.
member.returns: A new image in the new pixel format, with image data translated from the source image.
member.remarks: The default implementation uses the built-in AtalaImage.GetChangedPixelFormat method, which in turn uses the PixelFormatChanger installed in AtalaImage. By overriding this method, you can bypass the built-in pixel format translation and supply your own and isolate it to an individual command.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ThreadedCommand.ConstructImageResults
member.summary: Constructs the results object for this command.
member.returns: A new object of type ImageResults representing the results for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns an object of type ImageResults. If your command requires an object with more information, subclass ImageResults and add in the information you need. Your command will override ConstructImageResults and return your new object.
The object allocated here is passed to PerformActualCommand as a reference parameter, meaning the entire object can be changed at that point too.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ThreadedCommand.OptimalThreadCount
member.summary: Returns the best number of threads to use for the current system.
member.remarks: This is typically the number of CPUs available times two. The number of CPUs is not always the number of physical CPUs chips in the computer. For example, a computer with two dual core CPUs may report 8 for its OptimalThreadCount. Other variables like hyperthreading will affect the final count.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Thumbnail
member.summary: Summary description for Thumbnail.
Creates a high speed and high quality thumbnail image from a source file.

remarks.para: This class uses optimized image decoding and scaling to create a high quality thumbnail from a source image. It will used scaled loading when the source file is a JPEG, utilize scale to gray resampling when the source image is 1-bit with a document imaging license, and use area average otherwise.
This class can be conveniently used to generate thumbnail preview images.
note: when using DotImage Photo or Photo Pro, making a thumbnail out of a 1-bit image will take much more memory and be less efficient as it will convert to grayscale first, then resample the image.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Thumbnail._size
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum X and Y dimensions of the thumbnail to be created.
member.remarks: The actual thumbnail size will be calculated based on the Size value, maintaining the aspect ratio from the original image. For example, if the source image is 640x480 and the size is 100x100 the resulting thumbnail size will be 100x75.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Thumbnail._throwOnZeroDimensions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that will thrown an exception if the resized image ends up with zero dimensions.
member.remarks: Default value is false. In this case the smallest dimension is always 1 pixel.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.BumpMapTransform

summary.para: This transform applies a bump map texture to an image.

member.remarks: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will attempt to convert the image into one.

example.code:
' Load a 24-bit image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg")
' Load the bumpmap image. (must be an 8-bit grayscale image) Dim bump As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\bumpmap.jpg")
' Apply the command. Dim cmd As BumpMapTransform = New BumpMapTransform(0.8,bump) Dim result As AtalaImage = cmd.Apply(image).Image
' Dispose of the images. bump.Dispose() image.Dispose()

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.FlipCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the source image data is processed in-place as opposed to returning a new image.
member.value: A value indicating if the source image data is processed in-pace as opposed to returning a new image.
member.remarks: By default, this value is false. When false, this ImageCommand should never overwrite the original image. If an unmodified copy of the original image must be maintained and this property returns true, clone the image before applying this ImageCommand. Implementing classes should override this and set it to true when processing the source image directly. When this value is true, the object returned by may occupy the same memory space as the source image. The state of conveys whether the source image was actually modified in place.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.LensTransform

summary.para: Used to create a zoomed camera lens effect.

member.remarks: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will attempt to convert the image into one.

example.code:
' Load a 24-bit image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg")
Dim cmd As LensTransform = New LensTransform(image.Width / 2,PoInteger.Empty) Dim result As AtalaImage = cmd.Apply(image).Image
image.Dispose()

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.OffsetTransform
member.remarks: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will attempt to convert the image into one.
member.summary: Moves the image on the canvas by a specified number of pixels.

example.code:
' Load a 24-bit image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg")
' Use the OffsetTransform to reposition the image. Dim cmd As OffsetTransform = New OffsetTransform(New Point(image.Width / 2,image.Height / 2),OffsetTransformMode.DontWrapEdges) Dim result As AtalaImage = cmd.Apply(image).Image
image.Dispose()

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.PolygonTransform

summary.para: This transform resizes image rows (or columns) to fit inside the specified polygon. This polygon must be convex. If it is concave, the largest convex polygon that can be formed from the points will be used.

member.remarks: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will attempt to convert the image into one.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.PushCommand.SelectPreferredPixelFormat(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat,Atalasoft.Imaging.PixelFormat[])
member.summary: Chooses a pixel format that is preferred for this command.
member.param: The original source image.
The original image's pixel format.
An array of pixel formats supported by this command.
member.returns: A new pixel format to use for this command.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns the sourceFormat value.

In theory, a command should only ever return pixel format that it has direct support for. Unfortunately, many older commands advertised that they supported pixel formats that were not native to the command. To maintain compatibility with older versions of dotImage, this method allows a command to select a new pixel format for itself, without being bound to the ApplyToAnyPixelFormat property.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.PushCommand.PerformActualCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageResults@)
member.summary: PerformActualCommand does the actual work of the image processing command.
member.param: The source image for processing. This may be different from the original image.
The destination image. Dest will be null when InPlaceProcessing is true or when ConstructFinalImage returns null.

An area of the source image to process. When the destination image is non-null, it will always be the same size as imageArea. ImageArea only differs in size from the source image when the command is a subclass of ImageRegionCommand and when there is a region of interest.
The results object that will be used for this command.
member.returns: In most cases, PerformActualCommand should return null. When PerformActualCommand returns a non-null image, it is indicating that it has allocated a new image to use for the final image. This must be true if ConstructFinalImage returned null.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.QuadrilateralWarpCommand

summary.para: Similar to the , this transform additionally lets you specify a source polygon to allow further control over the warping of the image.

member.remarks: This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will raise the ChangePixelFormat event and convert the image to a continuous tone format, which can be 8-bit grayscale, RGB, or RGBA.

example.code:
' Load a 24-bit image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg")
' Prepare the warp positions. Dim bottomLeft As Point = New Point(100,image.Height - 80) Dim topLeft As Point = New Point(130,45) Dim topRight As Point = New Point(image.Width - 60,140) Dim bottomRight As Point = New Point(image.Width - 20,image.Height)
' Warp the image. QuadrilateralWarpCommand cmd = New QuadrilateralWarpCommand(bottomLeft, topLeft, topRight, bottomRight, InterpolationMode.BiLinear, Color.White)
Dim result As AtalaImage = cmd.Apply(image).Image image.Dispose()

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.QuadrilateralWarpCommand.ConstructFinalImage(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Called by the default implementation of Apply, ConstructFinalImage constructs the image that will be used as the destination image for the command.
member.param: The source image being processed. This may be different from the source image passed into Apply.
member.returns: A new image for the result of the command, or null if it is not possible or necessary to make a destination image.
member.exception: Unable to allocate destination image.

remarks.para: The default implementation returns a new image in the same pixel format as the source image.
The returned image must be the same size as the image passed in.

If it is not possible to allocate the image (for example, the pixel format is not know at this point), it is acceptable to return null. Returning null implies that the command will return a non-null image in PerformActualCommand.
If an error occurs, this method should throw an exception.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Transforms.ResizeCanvasCommand

remarks.para: This command can be used for adding a border to an image.

This method requires a continuous tone image. If the source image is not continuous, it will raise the ChangePixelFormat event and convert the image to a continuous tone format, which can be 8-bit grayscale, RGB, or RGBA.

member.summary: Overlays the current image onto a specified position on a new image of the specified background color.

example.code:
' Load a 24-bit image. Dim image As AtalaImage = New AtalaImage("D:\Test Images\1.jpg")
' Add a 40 pixel border around the image. Dim NewSize As Size = New Size(image.Width + 80,image.Height + 80)
' We position the image at 39, 39 because the top, left position is 0, 0. Dim cmd As ResizeCanvasCommand = New ResizeCanvasCommand(NewSize,New Point(39,39),Color.White) Dim result As AtalaImage = cmd.Apply(image).Image
image.Dispose()
